links.belarusian: "Хуткі розум. Гэты ўвесь Мулен выглядае так, нібы яму патрэбна некалькі гадзін, каб прыйсці да самай простай ідэі".

links.title: Annette: "She gazes at the image of Dick Mull..."
links.english: She gazes at the image of Dick Mullen, frowning. "Nooo, he's wicked smart in the stories."
links.polish: Wpatruje się w obrazek Dicka Mullena, marszcząc czoło. „Nie, w książkach jest diabelnie sprytny”.
links.belarusian: Узіраецца ў малюнак Дзіка Малена, зморшчыўшы лоб. "Не, у кнігах ён д'ябальскі хітры".

links.title: You: ""Sure, when the author does all the..."
links.english: "Sure, when the author does all the thinking for him. Real policemen have to think and act on their own."
links.polish: „Jasne, kiedy to autor myśli za niego. Prawdziwi policjanci muszą myśleć i działać sami”.
links.belarusian: "Вядома, калі аўтар думае за яго. Сапраўдныя паліцыянты павінны думаць і дзейнічаць самі".

links.title: Annette: ""Like you, sir, of course." She smi..."
links.english: "Like you, sir, of course." She smiles mischievously. "He's just a fictional character, he's no match for you."
links.polish: „Czyli tak jak pan” – uśmiecha się zadziornie. „To tylko zmyślona postać, z panem nie ma szans”.
links.belarusian: "Вось так, як вы", — задзірыста ўсміхаецца яна. "Гэта толькі выдуманы персанаж, з вамі няма шанцаў".

links.title: You: ""No, I meant your *mind*.""
links.english: "No, I meant your *mind*."
links.polish: „Nie, chodziło mi o *umysł*”.
links.belarusian: "Не, я меў на ўвазе *розум*".

links.title: Annette: ""But that's like... the same thing...."
links.english: "But that's like... the same thing." She squints her eyes, trying to solve this puzzle.
links.polish: „Ale to jakby... to samo” – mruży oczy, głowiąc się nad tą zagadką.
links.belarusian: "Але гэта як бы... тое самае" — прыжмурвае вочы, ламаючы галаву над гэтай загадкай.

links.title: You: ""In the eyes of a kid, maybe. The d..."
links.english: "In the eyes of a kid, maybe. The difference between me and Mullen is vast. He's nothing!"
links.polish: „W oczach dziecka może tak. Różnica między mną a Mullenem jest ogromna. On jest nikim!”
links.belarusian: "У вачах дзіцяці можа і так. Розніца паміж мной і Муленам велізарная. Ён ніхто!"

links.title: Annette: ""If you say so, sir." She smiles mi..."
links.english: "If you say so, sir." She smiles mischievously. "He's just a fictional character, he's no match for you."
links.polish: „Skoro pan tak mówi” – uśmiecha się zadziornie. „To tylko zmyślona postać, z panem nie ma szans”.
links.belarusian: "Калі вы так кажаце", — задзірыста ўсміхаецца. "Гэта толькі выдуманы персанаж, з вамі не параўнацца".

links.title: You: ""There's the mind... and there's *t..."
links.english: "There's the mind... and there's *the mind*, if you catch my drift."
links.polish: „Jest umysł i *umysł*. Mam nadzieję, że rozumiesz”.
links.belarusian: "Ёсць розум і *розум*. Спадзяюся, ты разумееш".

links.title: Annette: ""Uh, not really, sir.""
links.english: "Uh, not really, sir."
links.polish: „Uch, chyba nie do końca, psze pana”.
links.belarusian: "Ой, напэўна, не зусім, спадар."

links.title: You: ""See, that's what reading those fak..."
links.english: "See, that's what reading those fakey-fake Mullen books gets you. Now you're dealing with a real cop."
links.polish: „Widzisz, tyle właśnie ci dały te oszukańcze książki o Mullenie. A teraz masz do czynienia z prawdziwym gliniarzem”.
links.belarusian: "Відаеш, вось гэта ты і атрымаў ад тых ашуканскіх кніг пра Мулена. А цяпер ты маеш справу з сапраўдным мянтам".

links.title: Annette: ""Yes, sir." She smiles mischievousl..."
links.english: "Yes, sir." She smiles mischievously. "He's just a fictional character, I understand. He's no match for you."
links.polish: „Tak, psze pana” – uśmiecha się zadziornie. „To tylko zmyślona postać, rozumiem. Z panem nie ma szans”.
links.belarusian: "Так, спадар", — ўсміхаецца задзірліва. "Гэта толькі выдуманы персанаж, разумею. З вамі няма шанцаў".

links.title: You: ""Wow, look at the guy. I'll never b..."
links.english: "Wow, look at the guy. I'll never be as good as Mullen."
links.polish: „O rany, tylko na niego popatrz. Nigdy nie będę tak dobry jak Mullen”.
links.belarusian: "Ой, толькі паглядзі на яго. Я ніколі не буду такім добрым, як Мулен".

links.title: Annette: ""Don't say that. He's not even real..."
links.english: "Don't say that. He's not even real. You're real."
links.polish: „Proszę tak nie mówić. On nawet nie jest prawdziwy. A pan jest”.
links.belarusian: "Калі ласка, не кажыце так. Ён нават не сапраўдны. А вы ёсць".

links.title: You: ""That's right. A real *failure*.""
links.english: "That's right. A real *failure*."
links.polish: „To prawda. Jestem prawdziwą *porażką*”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта праўда. Я сапраўдная *няўдача*".

links.title: Annette: "Her eyes shine with sympathy. "Chee..."
links.english: Her eyes shine with sympathy. "Cheer up, sir. No need to compare yourself to a fictional character."
links.polish: Jej oczy wypełniają się współczuciem. „Proszę się rozchmurzyć. Nie ma co się porównywać z wymyśloną postacią”.
links.belarusian: Яе вочы напаўняюцца спачуваннем. "Калі ласка, не сумуйце. Ня трэба параўноўваць сябе з выдуманым персанажам".

links.title: Annette: ""Maybe you can show me some *real*..."
links.english: "Maybe you can show me some *real* deductive police work, sir? Like in the books!" Her smile is warm and consoling, unlike the imperial image of Dick Mullen.
links.polish: „Pokaże mi pan, jak wygląda *prawdziwa* dedukcja policyjna? Tak jak w książkach!” – jej uśmiech jest ciepły i krzepiący, to przeciwieństwo posągowego wizerunku Dicka Mullena.
links.belarusian: "Пакажыце мне, як выглядае *сапраўдная* паліцыйная дэдукцыя? Як у кнігах!" — яе ўсмешка цёплая і заспакаяльная, гэта поўная супрацьлегласць статустага вобраза Дзіка Мулена.

links.title: You: ""Overshadowed by a fake man? That's..."
links.english: "Overshadowed by a fake man? That's harsh."
links.polish: „Muszę żyć w cieniu nieistniejącego człowieka? Bolesne”.
links.belarusian: "Мне даводзіцца жыць у цені чалавека, якога не існуе? Балюча".

links.title: Annette: "She looks at you with sympathy. "Ch..."
links.english: She looks at you with sympathy. "Cheer up, sir. It's much easier being a fictional character, he doesn't have to deal with... real things."
links.polish: Patrzy na ciebie ze współczuciem. „Proszę się rozchmurzyć. Wymyślonym bohaterom jest łatwiej. Nie mają na głowie... prawdziwych problemów”.
links.belarusian: Глядзіць на цябе са спачуваннем. "Калі ласка, развяселіся. Прыдуманым героям лягчэй. У іх няма на галаве... сапраудных праблем".

links.title: You: ""I don't really want to DEAL with t..."
links.english: "I don't really want to DEAL with this. It's too much."
links.polish: „Nie chcę się teraz tym zajmować. To dla mnie za dużo”.
links.belarusian: "Не хачу гэтым цяпер займацца. Гэта для мяне зашмат".

links.title: Annette: "She looks at you with sympathy. "We..."
links.english: She looks at you with sympathy. "We can talk about something else if you want. Something nicer."
links.polish: Spogląda na ciebie ze współczuciem. „Jak pan chce, możemy porozmawiać o czymś innym. O czymś przyjemniejszym”.
links.belarusian: Глядзіць на вас са спачуваннем. "Як пажадаеце, можам пагаварыць пра нешта іншае. Пра нешта прыемнае".

links.title: You: ""Hmm... I actually had other questi..."
links.english: "Hmm... I actually had other questions."
links.polish: „Hmm... Mam jeszcze inne pytania”.
links.belarusian: "Хмм... У мяне яшчэ ёсць іншыя пытанні".

links.title: Annette: ""More about books, maybe?" Annette..."
links.english: "More about books, maybe?" Annette nods eagerly.
links.polish: „O książki?” – Annette kiwa głową entuzjastycznie.
links.belarusian: "Пра кнігі?" — Анэт ківае галавой з энтузіязмам.

links.title: You: ""Okay, then maybe I'm not a policem..."
links.english: "Okay, then maybe I'm not a policeman? Or should stop being one."
links.polish: „No dobra, to może wcale nie jestem policjantem? Albo powinienem przestać nim być”.
links.belarusian: "Ну добра, можа, я наогул не з'яўляюся паліцыянтам? Ці, можа, мне варта перастаць ім быць".

links.title: You: ""Okay, I get it. Crime-murder gets..."
links.english: "Okay, I get it. Crime-murder gets the people going."
links.polish: „Dobra, rozumiem. Morderstwa i zbrodnie rozbudzają emocje”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, разумею. Забойствы і злачынствы абуджаюць эмоцыі".

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm-mhm," she replies. "And it's k..."
links.english: "Mhm-mhm," she replies. "And it's kinda like a puzzle, too. You can guess who the criminal is or how the good guys are going to catch him."
links.polish: „Mhm-mhm” – odpowiada. „I to też trochę łamigłówka. Można zgadywać, kim jest przestępca albo jak ci dobrzy go złapią”.
links.belarusian: "Мгм-мгм," – адказвае ён. "І гэта таксама трохі галаваломка. Можна здагадвацца, кім з'яўляецца злачынец, альбо як добрыя хлопцы яго зловяць".

links.title: You: ""What is romance?""
links.english: "What is romance?"
links.polish: „Co to są romanse?”
links.belarusian: "Што такое раманы?"

links.title: Annette: ""It's the type of book where there'..."
links.english: "It's the type of book where there's a rich lady and she has to choose between the good man and the bad man." She smiles at the thought, perhaps imagining herself in that situation.
links.polish: „To takie książki, w których bogata pani musi wybrać dobrego mężczyznę albo złego” – uśmiecha się na myśl o tym, być może wyobrażając sobie siebie na miejscu bogatej pani.
links.belarusian: "Гэта такія кнігі, у якіх багатая дама павінна выбраць добрага мужчыну або дрэннага" – усміхаецца пры думцы аб гэтым, магчыма, уяўляючы сябе на месцы багатай дамы.

links.title: Annette: ""Or there could be a story about a..."
links.english: "Or there could be a story about a poor lady getting a rich man. It's about man and lady business, sir."
links.polish: „Może też być tak, że biedna pani zdobywa serce bogatego mężczyzny. To takie historie o sprawach pań i panów”.
links.belarusian: "Можа таксама быць так, што бедная спадарыня заваёўвае сэрца багатага мужчыны. Гэта такія гісторыі пра справы дам і паноў".

links.title: You: ""What about a poor man getting a ri..."
links.english: "What about a poor man getting a rich lady?"
links.polish: „A biedny mężczyzna nie może zdobyć bogatej pani?”
links.belarusian: "А бедны мужчына ня можа атрымаць багатай пані?"

links.title: Annette: ""It happens. But usually the guy ge..."
links.english: "It happens. But usually the guy gets rich in the process, or should actually be rich himself, but has lost his family property unjustly, like during the Revolution or something."
links.polish: „Tak też może być. Ale zazwyczaj ten facet po drodze staje się bogaty albo powinien być bogaty, ale niesprawiedliwie stracił cały majątek, na przykład podczas Rewolucji”.
links.belarusian: "Так таксама можа быць. Але звычайна гэты чалавек на шляху становіцца багатым альбо павінен быць багатым, але несправядліва страціў увесь маёнтак, напрыклад, падчас Рэвалюцыі".

links.title: You: ""I see.""
links.english: "I see."
links.polish: „Rozumiem”.
links.belarusian: "Разумею".

links.title: Annette: ""Those are unhappy books, for most..."
links.english: "Those are unhappy books, for most of the pages. People sad about what they have lost. But then it all turns out just fine in the end!"
links.polish: „Takie historie nie są na początku wesołe. Ludzie są nieszczęśliwi, bo stracili to, co mieli. Ale potem i tak wszystko dobrze się kończy!”
links.belarusian: "Такія гісторыі не бываюць спачатку вясёлымі. Людзі няшчасныя, бо страцілі тое, што мелі. Але потым усё роўна ўсё добра заканчваецца!"

links.title: You: ""What about when both of the men ar..."
links.english: "What about when both of the men are bad?"
links.polish: „A co kiedy żaden mężczyzna się nie nadaje?”
links.belarusian: "А што, калі ніводзін мужчына не падыходзіць?"

links.title: Annette: ""These are not very common. You can..."
links.english: "These are not very common. You can't have a choice between bad and bad, nobody wants to read a story like that."
links.polish: „Niewiele jest takich. Co to za wybór – pomiędzy złym a złym? Nikt nie chciałby czytać takiej historii”.
links.belarusian: "Мала такіх. Што гэта за выбар – паміж дрэнным і дрэнным? Ніхто не хацеў бы чытаць такую гісторыю".

links.title: You: ""What if it's written really well?""
links.english: "What if it's written really well?"
links.polish: „A gdyby była bardzo dobrze napisana?”
links.belarusian: "А калі б яна была вельмі добра напісана?"

links.title: Annette: ""Well... maybe then it's fine. Mayb..."
links.english: "Well... maybe then it's fine. Maybe if the lady then decides not to pick either, because she doesn't need a bad man. Yes, that would be interesting!"
links.polish: „Wtedy... może tak. Może jeśli ona nie wybierze żadnego – no bo po co jej zły mężczyzna? – to mogłoby być ciekawe!”
links.belarusian: "Тады... можа, так. Можа, калі яна не выбера ніводнага – бо навошта ёй дрэнны мужчына? – гэта можа быць цікава!"

links.title: You: ""What about when everyone is poor?""
links.english: "What about when everyone is poor?"
links.polish: „A co, kiedy wszyscy są biedni?”
links.belarusian: "А што, калі ўсе бедныя?"

links.title: Annette: ""That's really not a proper romance..."
links.english: "That's really not a proper romance story. That's more like everyday life!"
links.polish: „Wtedy to nie jest książkowy romans. Wtedy to po prostu życie!”
links.belarusian: "Тады гэта не кніжны раман. Тады гэта проста жыццё!"

links.title: You: ""Sometimes you have to write about..."
links.english: "Sometimes you have to write about real life things."
links.polish: „Czasem trzeba też pisać o prawdziwym życiu”.
links.belarusian: "Часам трэба таксама пісаць пра сапраўднае жыццё".

links.title: Annette: ""Not in romance books, sir. These a..."
links.english: "Not in romance books, sir. These are about nice and pretty people, and everyone is happy in the end."
links.polish: „Ale nie w romansach, psze pana. W nich są mili i ładni ludzie, a na końcu wszyscy są szczęśliwi”.
links.belarusian: "Але не ў раманах, спадар. Там добрыя і прыгожыя людзі, а ў канцы ўсе шчаслівыя".

links.title: You: ""Yeah, poor people are boring.""
links.english: "Yeah, poor people are boring."
links.polish: „Tak, biedni ludzie są nudni”.
links.belarusian: "Так, бедныя людзі нудныя".

links.title: Annette: ""I guess, yes. People in books are..."
links.english: "I guess, yes. People in books are always very interesting. Especially the romance-people."
links.polish: „No chyba. Ludzie w książkach zawsze są bardzo ciekawi. Szczególnie ci z romansów”.
links.belarusian: "Ну напэўна. Людзі ў кнігах заўсёды вельмі цікавыя. Асабліва тыя з раманаў".

links.title: You: ""What about a book where the *man a..."
links.english: "What about a book where the *man and lady business* doesn't work out at all?"
links.polish: „A są książki, w których całe te *damsko-męskie interesy* zupełnie nie wypalają?”
links.belarusian: "А ёсць кнігі, у якіх усе гэтыя *жаноча-мужчынскія інтарэсы* зусім не спраўджваюцца?"

links.title: Annette: ""I haven't read many of... those. M..."
links.english: "I haven't read many of... those. Maybe you should ask Mum?"
links.polish: „Nie znam wielu... takich. Proszę spytać mamę”.
links.belarusian: "Не ведаю шмат... такіх. Калі ласка, спытайце ў мамы".

links.title: You: ""Yeah? You think she has one about..."
links.english: "Yeah? You think she has one about an *excruciatingly painful* breakup?"
links.polish: „Tak? Myślisz że będzie miała jakąś książkę o *piekielnie bolesnym* rozstaniu?”
links.belarusian: "Так? Думаеш, што ў яе будзе нейкая кніга пра *пякельна балючае* расстанне?"

links.title: Annette: ""I don't think it's a romance story..."
links.english: "I don't think it's a romance story if the main characters break up, though..." She pauses, trying to figure out the appropriate answer.
links.polish: „Jeśli główni bohaterowie się rozstają, to już chyba nie jest romans...” – przerywa, zastanawiając się nad tym zagadnieniem.
links.belarusian: "Калі галоўныя героі расстаюцца, то гэта, мабыць, ужо не раман..." — перапыняе, разважаючы над гэтым пытаннем.

links.title: You: ""No-no, think about it! One where t..."
links.english: "No-no, think about it! One where they plunge into a torrid spiral of pain and recrimination. Only it's *really long* and drawn out. Scarred for life. Phantom limb!"
links.polish: „Nie, nie, zastanów się! Taki, w którym wpadają w potężny wir bólu i wzajemnych oskarżeń. To *bardzo długa* i ciągnąca się opowieść. Rany, które się nie zabliźniają. Ból fantomowy!”
links.belarusian: "Не, не, падумай! Той, у якім яны трапляюць у магутны вір болю і ўзаемных абвінавачванняў. Гэта *вельмі доўгая* і працяглая аповесць. Раны, якія не зажываюць. Фантомны боль!"

links.title: Annette: ""Ummm... no? I don't know..." She l..."
links.english: "Ummm... no? I don't know..." She looks at you with puzzlement.
links.polish: „Eee... nie? Nie wiem...” – patrzy na ciebie z konsternacją.
links.belarusian: "Эээ... не? Я не ведаю..." – глядзіць на цябе з разгубленасцю.

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You can take this! Blossom like a p..."
links.english: You can take this! Blossom like a pain-flower.
links.polish: Masz to w garści! Rozkwitnij niczym kwiat bólu.
links.belarusian: Ты маеш гэта ў руцэ! Разквітні як кветка болю.

links.title: You: ""Yeah. Yeah! And it drags on for *y..."
links.english: "Yeah. Yeah! And it drags on for *years* and *years* with no resolution in sight..."
links.polish: „Tak. Tak! I ciągnie się całymi *latami*. Próżno czekać, aż to się rozwiąże...”
links.belarusian: "Так. Так! І цягнецца цэлымі *гадамі*. Марна чакаць, пакуль гэта вырашыцца..."

links.title: Annette: "The girl is at a loss for words."
links.english: The girl is at a loss for words.
links.polish: Dziewczynce brakuje słów.
links.belarusian: Дзяўчынцы не хапае слоў.

links.title: You: ""... each of you filling with resen..."
links.english: "... each of you filling with resentment and bitterness for having *ruined* each other's lives..."
links.polish: „Każde z was pełne nienawiści i zgorzknienia, bo *zrujnowaliście* sobie nawzajem życia...”
links.belarusian: "Кожны з вас поўны нянавісці і горычы, бо *зруйнавалі* адзін аднаму жыцці..."

links.title: Annette: "She shifts and sways on her feet, l..."
links.english: She shifts and sways on her feet, looking confused and uncomfortable.
links.polish: Szura stopami i kołysze się, dając wyraz swojemu zakłopotaniu.
links.belarusian: Трытупае нагамі і гушкаецца, выказваючы сваё збянтэжанне.

links.title: Volition: "Stop. There's no need for this. It'..."
links.english: Stop. There's no need for this. It's in your power to change the subject.
links.polish: Przestań. To nie jest potrzebne. Jesteś w stanie zmienić temat na inny.
links.belarusian: Супыніся. Гэта не трэба. Ты ў стане змяніць тэму на іншую.

links.title: You: ""... each of you tearing at the oth..."
links.english: "... each of you tearing at the other's innards, leaving a gaping emptiness, a vacuum heart that still hurts ceaselessly!"
links.polish: „Rozszarpujecie sobie nawzajem wnętrzności, zostawiając tylko ziejącą pustkę. Zawieszone w próżni serce, które tylko boli bez końca!”
links.belarusian: "Распінаеце адзін аднаго нутро, пакідаючы толькі зяючасцю пустэчу. Падвешанае ў вакууме сэрца, якое толькі баліць без канца!"

links.title: Annette: ""I'm sorry, sir, I don't know how t..."
links.english: "I'm sorry, sir, I don't know how to help you..."
links.polish: „Przepraszam, nie wiem, jak panu pomóc...”
links.belarusian: "Прабачце, не ведаю, як вам дапамагчы..."

links.title: You: ""I don't need *help*, I need a real..."
links.english: "I don't need *help*, I need a real book that tells it how it *is*, not this drivel."
links.polish: „Nie potrzebuję *pomocy*. Potrzebuję prawdziwej książki o tym, jak *jest*, a nie tego śmiecia”.
links.belarusian: "Мне не патрэбна *дапамога*. Мне патрэбна сапраўдная кніга пра тое, як *ёсць*, а не гэты смецце".

links.title: Annette: ""Sir, sorry, sir. I'm still little?..."
links.english: "Sir, sorry, sir. I'm still little?" She stumbles on her words. "I don't... I can't..."
links.polish: „Przepraszam pana. Jestem jeszcze mała” – gubi się we własnych słowach. „Nie wiem... nie umiem...”
links.belarusian: "Прабачце, спадар. Я яшчэ маленькая", — блытаецца ў сваіх словах. "Не ведаю... не ўмею..."

links.title: Volition: "It's time to leave it be. You're ab..."
links.english: It's time to leave it be. You're about to make a child cry. Are you proud of yourself?
links.polish: Najwyższy czas odpuścić. Zaraz doprowadzisz dziecko do płaczu. Dumny z siebie jesteś?
links.belarusian: Пара ўжо спыніцца. Хутка ты давядзеш дзіця да слёз. Ганарышся сабой?

links.title: You: "Not a single shred of pride remains..."
links.english: Not a single shred of pride remains in me.
links.polish: Nie ostał się we mnie nawet strzępek dumy.
links.belarusian: Не засталося ўва мне нават аскепка гонару.

links.title: Volition: "This is your *tiny* chance for rede..."
links.english: This is your *tiny* chance for redemption. Apologize.
links.polish: Oto twoja *maleńka* szansa na zrehabilitowanie się. Przeproś.
links.belarusian: Вось твой *маленькі* шанец на рэабілітацыю. Папрасі прабачэння.

links.title: You: ""Little girl, I'm sorry I got agita..."
links.english: "Little girl, I'm sorry I got agitated. I just can't handle things sometimes. Let's get back to books."
links.polish: „Dziewczynko, przepraszam, że się zirytowałem. Czasem sobie nie daję trochę rady. Wróćmy do rozmowy o książkach”.
links.belarusian: "Дзяўчынка, прашу прабачэння, што я раззлаваўся. Часам мне гэта ciężka. Давайце вернемся да размовы пра кнігі".

links.title: Annette: ""Yes... yes, sir!" She blinks her e..."
links.english: "Yes... yes, sir!" She blinks her eyes rapidly, in confusion and relief.
links.polish: „Tak... dobrze, psze pana!” – mruga raz za razem, dając wyraz dezorientacji, ale i uldze.
links.belarusian: "Так... добра, пане!" — раз-по-раз міргае, выказваючы разгубленасць, але і палёгку.

links.title: You: "Right. Activate Denial Mode."
links.english: Right. Activate Denial Mode.
links.polish: No tak. Aktywuję tryb wyparcia.
links.belarusian: Ну так. Актывую рэжым вытяснення.

links.title: Volition: "You're not really an automaton, you..."
links.english: You're not really an automaton, you do know that?
links.polish: Nie jesteś maszyną. Zdajesz sobie z tego sprawę?
links.belarusian: Вы не машына. Вы разумееце гэта?

links.title: You: ""Little girl, pardon the deviation...."
links.english: "Little girl, pardon the deviation. I wish to discuss books and other such matters."
links.polish: „Wybacz mi ten wybuch, dziecko. Chcę porozmawiać o książkach i innych takich rzeczach”.
links.belarusian: "Прабач мне гэты ўсплёск, дзіця. Я хачу пагаварыць пра кнігі і іншыя такія рэчы".

links.title: You: "Damn right I am! Proud as the Lion..."
links.english: Damn right I am! Proud as the Lion of Serber.
links.polish: Jak jasna cholera! Dumny niczym Lew Serberu.
links.belarusian: Як ясная халера! Ганарлівы, як Леў Серберу.

links.title: Volition: "Excuse me, I'm not sure I heard tha..."
links.english: Excuse me, I'm not sure I heard that properly...
links.polish: Przepraszam, chyba coś mi się przesłyszało...
links.belarusian: Прабачце, напэўна, мне нешта пачулася...

links.title: You: ""I said I'm proud like a goddamn li..."
links.english: "I said I'm proud like a goddamn lion!"
links.polish: „Powiedziałem, że jestem dumny jak cholerny lew!”
links.belarusian: "Я сказаў, што ганаруся як пракляты леў!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wonderful.""
links.english: "Wonderful."
links.polish: „Cudownie”.
links.belarusian: "Цудоўна".

links.title: Annette: "Her eyes grow wide as she tries to..."
links.english: Her eyes grow wide as she tries to comprehend the outburst. "I'm sorry, sir?"
links.polish: Otwiera oczy coraz szerzej, próbując zrozumieć ten wybuch. „Przepraszam, psze pana?”
links.belarusian: Адкрывае вочы ўсё шырэй, імкнучыся зразумець гэты выбух. "Прабачце, спадар?"

links.title: You: ""You heard me! I'm full of pride an..."
links.english: "You heard me! I'm full of pride and I ready to talk about books. Let's do this."
links.polish: „Dobrze słyszałaś! Jestem pełen dumy i gotowości do rozmowy o książkach. Do dzieła!”
links.belarusian: "Добра чула! Я поўны гонару і гатоўнасці да размовы пра кнігі. За справу!"

links.title: Annette: ""Yes... yes, sir!" She blinks her e..."
links.english: "Yes... yes, sir!" She blinks her eyes rapidly, in confusion and relief.
links.polish: „Tak... dobrze, psze pana!” – mruga raz za razem, dając wyraz dezorientacji, ale i uldze.
links.belarusian: "Так... добра, пане!" — міргнуў ён раз за разам, выказваючы збянтэжанасць, але і палёгку.

links.title: You: ""I... uh... don't worry, little gir..."
links.english: "I... uh... don't worry, little girl. Got a bit carried away there. Let's back up out of this."
links.polish: „Ja... Yyy... Nie przejmuj się, dziewczynko. Trochę mnie poniosło. Lepiej zakończmy ten temat”.
links.belarusian: "Я... Гм... Не хвалюйся, дзяўчынка. Трошкі мяне занесла. Лепш закончым гэтую тэму".

links.title: You: ""Why can't you help me? I'm beyond..."
links.english: "Why can't you help me? I'm beyond help, right?"
links.polish: „Czemu nie możesz mi pomóc? Pewnie nic się już nie da zrobić, co?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму ты не можаш мне дапамагчы? Напэўна, ужо нельга нічога зрабіць, так?"

links.title: You: ""On second thought, this seems like..."
links.english: "On second thought, this seems like an inappropriate topic to discuss with children."
links.polish: „W sumie to chyba nie jest temat, o którym się powinno rozmawiać z dzieckiem”.
links.belarusian: "У цэлым, гэта, напэўна, не тая тэма, на якую варта гаварыць з дзіцём".

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm!" She nods enthusiastically, o..."
links.english: "Mhm!" She nods enthusiastically, obviously relieved.
links.polish: „Mhm!” – entuzjastycznie kiwa głową z ewidentną ulgą.
links.belarusian: "Мгм!" — з энтузіязмам ківае галавой з яўным палёгкай.

links.title: You: ""Doesn't ring a bell? Alright, I'll..."
links.english: "Doesn't ring a bell? Alright, I'll ask your mom."
links.polish: „Nie kojarzysz nic takiego? No dobrze, spytam twoją mamę”.
links.belarusian: "Не памятаеш нічога падобнага? Ну добра, спытаю ў тваёй маці".

links.title: Annette: ""Yes!" She nods, relieved. "She kno..."
links.english: "Yes!" She nods, relieved. "She knows books, definitely."
links.polish: „Tak!” – przytakuje z ulgą. „Ona zna się na książkach jak nikt!”
links.belarusian: "Так!" — падтаквае з палёгкай. "Яна ведае кнігі, як ніхто!"

links.title: Conceptualization: "What *was* that? An idea for an unf..."
links.english: What *was* that? An idea for an unfinished novel stuck somewhere in your fore-brain?
links.polish: Co to *było*? Pomysł na nieukończoną powieść, który utknął ci gdzieś w płacie czołowym?
links.belarusian: Што гэта *было*? Ідэя незавершанага рамана, якая заклінела ў лбе?

links.title: Volition: "You clearly have issues you need to..."
links.english: You clearly have issues you need to address.
links.polish: Ewidentnie masz ze sobą problemy, którymi powinieneś się zająć.
links.belarusian: Відавочна, у цябе ёсць праблемы, якімі варта заняцца.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Later when you get the chance, you..."
links.english: Later when you get the chance, you should address these issues -- by getting *drunk*. That'll show them!
links.polish: Jak później będziesz miał chwilę, zajmij się tymi problemami – *upij się*! To im wszystkim pokaże!
links.belarusian: Калі потым у цябе будзе хвіліна, займіся гэтымі праблемамі – *напіся*! Гэта ім усім пакажа!

links.title: You: ""Okay.""
links.english: "Okay."
links.polish: „Rozumiem”.
links.belarusian: "Разумею".

links.title: Annette: ""Sometimes they break up for a litt..."
links.english: "Sometimes they break up for a little while, but then they always get back together."
links.polish: „Czasem na chwilę się rozstają, ale w końcu zawsze do siebie wracają”.
links.belarusian: "Часам на нейкі час расстаюцца, але ў рэшце рэшт заўсёды вяртаюцца адно да аднаго".

links.title: You: ""Maybe I will.""
links.english: "Maybe I will."
links.polish: „Może tak zrobię”.
links.belarusian: "Можа, так зроблю".

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm. I'm sure she can help out!" S..."
links.english: "Mhm. I'm sure she can help out!" She smiles wide. "Anything else you're curious about?"
links.polish: „Mhm, na pewno panu pomoże!” – uśmiecha się szeroko. „Coś jeszcze pana ciekawi?”
links.belarusian: "Ммм, напэўна, дапаможа вам!" – шырока ўсміхаецца. "Ці ёсць яшчэ нешта, што вас цікавіць?"

links.title: You: ""That's enough romance for me. I ha..."
links.english: "That's enough romance for me. I had other questions."
links.polish: „Dość już o romansach. Mam inne pytania”.
links.belarusian: "Досыць ужо пра раманы. У мяне ёсць іншыя пытанні".

links.title: Annette: ""Maybe some about other books?" She..."
links.english: "Maybe some about other books?" She rubs her chilled nose with her fist.
links.polish: „To może jakieś inne książki?” – pociera zmarznięty nos pięścią.
links.belarusian: "Можа, якія-небудзь іншыя кнігі?" – пацярае змерзлы нос кулаком.

links.title: You: ""Who are these... famous people?""
links.english: "Who are these... famous people?"
links.polish: „Kim są te... słynne osoby?”
links.belarusian: "Хто гэтыя... знакамітыя асобы?"

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, kings and queens and generals..."
links.english: "Oh, kings and queens and generals of old, or artists and writers, or musicians, those kinds of people. There's usually something extraordinary about them." She scratches her cold-reddened cheek, then continues:
links.polish: „O, to królowie, królowe, dawni generałowie albo artyści, pisarze, muzycy, tacy sławni ludzie. Zazwyczaj ich życie jest niezwykłe” – drapie się po zarumienionym od zimna policzku i ciągnie dalej:
links.belarusian: "О, гэта каралі, каралевы, былыя генералы альбо мастакі, пісьменнікі, музыкі, такія вядомыя людзі. Звычайна іх жыццё незвычайнае" – чухае па пачырванеўшай ад халоду шчацэ і працягвае далей:

links.title: Annette: ""I think that's why people read the..."
links.english: "I think that's why people read them. To find the secrets of their fame."
links.polish: „Chyba dlatego ludzie to czytają. Żeby odkryć sekrety ich sławy”.
links.belarusian: "Мабыць, менавіта таму людзі гэта чытаюць. Каб адкрыць сакрэты іх славы".

links.title: Logic: "Seems like most people who read tho..."
links.english: Seems like most people who read those books fail to get more famous from reading them.
links.polish: Zdaje się, że większość ludzi, którzy czytują te książki, raczej nie staje się dzięki temu sławniejsza.
links.belarusian: Здаецца, што большасць людзей, якія чытаюць гэтыя кнігі, наўрад ці становяцца дзякуючы гэтаму больш вядомымі.

links.title: You: ""Reading those doesn't make the rea..."
links.english: "Reading those doesn't make the readers more famous, does it?"
links.polish: „Czytanie ich nie sprawia, że czytelnik staje się słynniejszy, prawda?”
links.belarusian: "Чытанне іх не робіць чытача больш вядомым, так?"

links.title: Annette: ""But it does make the famous people..."
links.english: "But it does make the famous people more famous!" She smiles gleefully.
links.polish: „Ale sławni ludzie stają się bardziej sławni!” – uśmiecha się radośnie.
links.belarusian: "Але вядомыя людзі становяцца яшчэ болей вядомымі!" — радасна ўсміхаецца.

links.title: Half Light: "They're all dorks."
links.english: They're all dorks.
links.polish: Banda palantów.
links.belarusian: Банда балбесаў.

links.title: You: ""Fame sounds delicious. Maybe someo..."
links.english: "Fame sounds delicious. Maybe someone will write a book about me one day."
links.polish: „Sława brzmi przepysznie. Może kiedyś ktoś napisze książkę o mnie”.
links.belarusian: "Слава гучыць пышна. Можа калісьці нехта напіша кнігу пра мяне".

links.title: Annette: ""Why would they do that, sir?""
links.english: "Why would they do that, sir?"
links.polish: „Po co miałby to robić?”
links.belarusian: "Навошта яму гэта рабіць?"

links.title: You: ""Because I'll be a superstar cop, i..."
links.english: "Because I'll be a superstar cop, in the papers and everything! That'll show 'em."
links.polish: „Bo będę supergwiazdorskim gliną, napiszą o mnie w gazetach i w ogóle! I wtedy zobaczą”.
links.belarusian: "Бо буду суперзоркавым мянтам, напішуць пра мяне ў газетах і наогул! І тады яны ўбачаць".

links.title: Annette: ""That's so cool! Maybe they'll make..."
links.english: "That's so cool! Maybe they'll make you a book cover picture and everything! Standing over a dead body, holding a gun..."
links.polish: „Ale super! Może trafi pan nawet na okładkę książki! Z bronią w ręku, stojący nad jakimś ciałem...”
links.belarusian: "Вось дык клясна! Можа, пан нават трапіць на вокладку кнігі! З зброяй у руцэ, стоячы над нейкім целам..."

links.title: You: ""Hmm... why indeed? I'm just an old..."
links.english: "Hmm... why indeed? I'm just an old, tired cop. What use am I?"
links.polish: „Hm... Faktycznie, po co? Jestem tylko starym, zmęczonym gliniarzem. Co ze mnie za pożytek?”
links.belarusian: "Хм... Сапраўды, навошта? Я ж толькі стары, стомлены паліцэйскі. Якая з мяне карысць?"

links.title: Annette: ""You're not that old... maybe you'l..."
links.english: "You're not that old... maybe you'll do something really important. Something that *wows the world*!"
links.polish: „Nie jest pan aż tak stary... może zrobi pan jeszcze coś bardzo ważnego. Coś, co *zadziwi świat*”.
links.belarusian: "Вы не такі ўжо стары... магчыма, вы зробіце яшчэ нешта вельмі важнае. Нешта, што *здзіўляе свет*".

links.title: You: ""You think so?""
links.english: "You think so?"
links.polish: „Tak myślisz?”
links.belarusian: "Так думаеш?"

links.title: Annette: ""Yes! There's hope... a lot of famo..."
links.english: "Yes! There's hope... a lot of famous people got famous late, or even after they died."
links.polish: „Tak! Jest nadzieja... Wielu sławnych ludzi późno zdobyło sławę. Niektórzy dopiero po śmierci”.
links.belarusian: "Так! Ёсць надзея... Многія вядомыя людзі пазней заваявалі славу. Некаторыя толькі пасля смерці".

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yeah, you're certainly the type who..."
links.english: Yeah, you're certainly the type who might find fame *posthumously*. Who knows, you might even get famous for the *manner* of your death!
links.polish: Tak, zdecydowanie jesteś typem człowieka zdobywającego sławę *pośmiertnie*. Kto wie, może jej przyczyną będzie nawet *sposób*, w jaki umrzesz?
links.belarusian: Так, безумоўна, вы тып чалавека, які набывае славу *пасмяротна*. Хто ведае, можа, яе прычынай нават стане *спосаб*, якім вы памрэце?

links.title: You: ""That sounds like a nice story to t..."
links.english: "That sounds like a nice story to tell yourself at night. Maybe fame isn't that important after all."
links.polish: „To brzmi jak miła pocieszanka do opowiadania sobie przed snem. Może sława nie jest jednak taka ważna?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта гучыць як мілая ўцеха для апавядання сабе перад сном. Можа, вядомасць усё ж такі не такая важная?"

links.title: Annette: ""Maybe not! No one *needs* a book w..."
links.english: "Maybe not! No one *needs* a book written about them anyway." She grins. "It's always better to read books!"
links.polish: „Może nie! Kto *chciałby* czytać książki o sobie” – szczerzy się – „skoro można po prostu czytać książki!”
links.belarusian: "Можа не! Хто *хацеў бы* чытаць кнігі пра сябе," – усміхаецца ён, – "калі можна проста чытаць кнігі!"

links.title: You: ""Some can't get noticed, others can..."
links.english: "Some can't get noticed, others can't get properly forgotten. That's life for you."
links.polish: „Niektórzy nie zostają zauważeni, inni nie mogą doczekać się zapomnienia. Takie już jest życie”.
links.belarusian: "Некаторыя застаюцца незаўважанымі, іншыя не могуць дачакацца забыцця. Такое ўжо жыццё".

links.title: Annette: ""I think you just have to live a ha..."
links.english: "I think you just have to live a happy life!" She rubs her nose. "No need to worry about fame or think bad thoughts!"
links.polish: „Myślę, że trzeba po prostu żyć szczęśliwie!” – pociera nos. „Nie martwić się o sławę i nie myśleć o złych rzeczach!”
links.belarusian: "Думаю, трэба проста жыць шчасліва!" — пацірае нос. "Не турбавацца пра славу і не думаць пра дрэнныя рэчы!"

links.title: You: ""But what if I get famous only thro..."
links.english: "But what if I get famous only through dying? I couldn't enjoy the fame at all."
links.polish: „Ale co, jeśli stanę się sławny właśnie przez śmierć? W ogóle bym się tym nie nacieszył”.
links.belarusian: "Але што, калі я стану вядомым менавіта праз смерць? Я б зусім гэтым не стаў атрымліваць асалоду".

links.title: Annette: ""I don't think you should live life..."
links.english: "I don't think you should live life with that fear." She stamps on her feet. "Just try to be the best you can!"
links.polish: „Nie warto się tym zamartwiać” – przebiera nogami. „Trzeba starać się po prostu być jak najlepszym!”
links.belarusian: "Не варта з гэтага турбавацца" — перабягае нагамі. "Трэба старацца проста быць як мага лепшым!"

links.title: You: ""Thanks, girl. You are very kind.""
links.english: "Thanks, girl. You are very kind."
links.polish: „Dziękuję, dziewczynko. Jesteś bardzo miła”.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй, дзяўчынка. Ты вельмі мілая".

links.title: Annette: ""Yes, sir!" She smiles and takes a..."
links.english: "Yes, sir!" She smiles and takes a sip from her vacuum bottle.
links.polish: „Nie ma za co, psze pana!” – uśmiecha się i popija ze swojego termosu.
links.belarusian: "Няма за што, спадар!" – усміхаецца і папівае са свайго тэрмаса.

links.title: You: ""Fame is... for vain people. I have..."
links.english: "Fame is... for vain people. I have better things to do."
links.polish: „Sława jest... dla próżnych ludzi. Mam lepsze rzeczy do roboty”.
links.belarusian: "Слава — гэта... для ганарлівых людзей. У мяне ёсць больш важныя рэчы, каб зрабіць".

links.title: Annette: ""Okay, sir!" She stamps her feet, w..."
links.english: "Okay, sir!" She stamps her feet, waiting for what comes next.
links.polish: „Dobrze, psze pana!” – drepcze w miejscu, czekając na ciąg dalszy.
links.belarusian: "Добра, спадар!" — тупае на месцы, чакаючы працягу.

links.title: You: ""These famous people sound like a b..."
links.english: "These famous people sound like a bunch of dorks."
links.polish: „Te słynne osoby brzmią jak banda palantów”.
links.belarusian: "Гэтыя знакамітыя асобы гучаць як грамада дурняў".

links.title: Annette: "Annette's expression remains ever s..."
links.english: Annette's expression remains ever so helpful, but she doesn't say anything.
links.polish: Twarz Annette nie przestaje wyrażać ochoczej gotowości do pomocy, ale dziewczynka milczy.
links.belarusian: Твар Анэт не перастае выражаць ахвотную гатоўнасць да дапамогі, але дзяўчынка маўчыць.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, you heard me. Only losers wa..."
links.english: "Yeah, you heard me. Only losers waste their time with that garbage."
links.polish: „Właśnie tak. Tylko przegrańcy marnują swój czas na takie bzdury”.
links.belarusian: "Вось так. Толькі няўдачнікі марнуюць свой час на такую лухту".

links.title: Annette: ""Isn't that kind of a childish thin..."
links.english: "Isn't that kind of a childish thing for a grown-up to say?"
links.polish: „Mówi pan bardzo dziecinnie jak na dorosłego”.
links.belarusian: "Вы кажаеце вельмі па-дзіцячы, як для дарослага".

links.title: Conceptualization: "When she grows up, and if she grows..."
links.english: When she grows up, and if she grows up to be clever, she'll discover there's no such thing as a 'grown-up.'
links.polish: Jeśli wyrośnie, a przy tym nie zabraknie jej sprytu, odkryje, że nie ma czegoś takiego jak dorosłość.
links.belarusian: Калі яна вырасце, і пры гэтым не страціць спрыт, то адкрые, што няма такой з'явы, як даросласць.

links.title: Half Light: "These people deserve to *die*."
links.english: These people deserve to *die*.
links.polish: Tacy ludzie zasługują na *śmierć*.
links.belarusian: Такія людзі заслугоўваюць *смерці*.

links.title: You: ""If you grow up to be clever, you'l..."
links.english: "If you grow up to be clever, you'll discover there's no such thing as a 'grown-up.'"
links.polish: „Jeśli wyrośniesz na spryciarę, odkryjesz, że nie ma czegoś takiego jak dorosłość”.
links.belarusian: "Калі будзеш хітраваць, выявіш, што няма такога паняцця, як даросласць".

links.title: Annette: ""Okay... sir.""
links.english: "Okay... sir."
links.polish: „Dobrze... psze pana”.
links.belarusian: "Добра... пшан пане".

links.title: Empathy: "She doesn't know what to make of th..."
links.english: She doesn't know what to make of that. But she'll remember it.
links.polish: Nie wie, co o tym myśleć. Lecz to zapamięta.
links.belarusian: Не ведае, што пра гэта думаць. Але гэта запомніць.

links.title: You: ""What makes you think I'm grown up?""
links.english: "What makes you think I'm grown up?"
links.polish: „Skąd pomysł, że jestem dorosły?”
links.belarusian: "Адкуль думка, што я дарослы?"

links.title: Annette: ""You look all wrinkly and hairy, li..."
links.english: "You look all wrinkly and hairy, like an old person!"
links.polish: „Wszędzie ma pan zmarszczki i włosy, więc jest pan stary!”
links.belarusian: "Усюды ў вас маршчыны і валасы, так што вы стары!"

links.title: Endurance: "You also *feel* old: tired, hardly..."
links.english: You also *feel* old: tired, hardly able to catch your breath, your joints aching constantly.
links.polish: Poza tym *czujesz się* stary. Jesteś zmęczony, wciąż brakuje ci tchu, bez ustanku bolą cię stawy.
links.belarusian: Акрамя таго, *адчуваеш сябе* старым. Ты стомлены, увесь час не хапае дыху, бязмежна баліць суставы.

links.title: You: ""Hrm! I'm not that old, I'm doing j..."
links.english: "Hrm! I'm not that old, I'm doing just fine, thank you very much."
links.polish: „Pff! Nie jestem aż tak stary, mam się naprawdę dobrze, dziękuję bardzo”.
links.belarusian: "Пф! Я не такі ўжо стары, у мяне ўсё сапраўды добра, вялікі дзякуй".

links.title: Annette: ""If you say so, sir!" She beams you..."
links.english: "If you say so, sir!" She beams you a piercing smile.
links.polish: „Skoro pan tak mówi!” – wymierza w ciebie szeroki uśmiech.
links.belarusian: "Калі вы так кажаце!" – шырокая ўсмешка накіравана на вас.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I'm old. That's just what ha..."
links.english: "Yeah, I'm old. That's just what happens to people."
links.polish: „Tak. Jestem stary. Tak to już się dzieje z ludźmi”.
links.belarusian: "Так. Я стары. Так гэта ўжо адбываецца з людзьмі".

links.title: Annette: ""I wonder how I'll be when I get ol..."
links.english: "I wonder how I'll be when I get old..." She mumbles. "Maybe I'll also get all wrinkly..." She giggles to herself.
links.polish: „Ciekawe, jak ja będę wyglądać na starość...” – mruczy pod nosem. „Może też będę cała pomarszczona...” – chichocze na myśl o tym.
links.belarusian: "Цікава, як я буду выглядаць у старасці..." — бурчыць сабе пад нос. "Можа, таксама буду ўся зморшчаная..." — хіхікае пры гэтай думцы.

links.title: You: ""I look *Harry*? That can't be me,..."
links.english: "I look *Harry*? That can't be me, not *Harry* -- what are you talking about?"
links.polish: „Jestem *Harry*? *Harry* to nie mogę być ja. O czym ty mówisz?”
links.belarusian: "Я — *Гары*? *Гары* — гэта не можа быць я. Пра што ты кажаш?"

links.title: Annette: ""Hairy, sir. I said hairy. Covered..."
links.english: "Hairy, sir. I said hairy. Covered with hair..." She sways on her feet, puzzled.
links.polish: „»Stary«, psze pana. Pomarszczony ze starości...” – kołysze się na stopach zdezorientowana.
links.belarusian: ""Стары", спадар. Зморшчаны ад старасці..." — калыхаеца на нагах разгублена.

links.title: You: ""Maybe...?""
links.english: "Maybe...?"
links.polish: „Może...?”
links.belarusian: "Можа...?"

links.title: Annette: "She gives you a quizzical look, not..."
links.english: She gives you a quizzical look, not understanding the reasoning behind your odd outbursts.
links.polish: Przygląda ci się skonsternowana, nie rozumiejąc, z czego wynikają twoje dziwne wybuchy.
links.belarusian: Яна глядзіць на цябе з разгубленасцю, не разумеючы, адкуль бяруцца твае дзіўныя ўсплёскі.

links.title: You: ""Maybe I should start *killing* the..."
links.english: "Maybe I should start *killing* these famous people. Hunt them down."
links.polish: „Może powinienem zacząć *zabijać* tych sławnych ludzi. Polować na nich”.
links.belarusian: "Можа, я павінен пачаць *забіваць* гэтых знакамітых людзей. Паляваць на іх".

links.title: Annette: ""Sir?!" She looks at you, eyes wide..."
links.english: "Sir?!" She looks at you, eyes wide in shock.
links.polish: „Co pan mówi?!” – patrzy na ciebie pełnym przerażenia wzrokiem.
links.belarusian: "Што вы гаворыце?!" – глядзіць на цябе поўным жаху позіркам.

links.title: You: ""They *deserve* punishment for all..."
links.english: "They *deserve* punishment for all the things they had to do get so famous."
links.polish: „*Zasługują* na karę za wszystkie te rzeczy, które musieli zrobić, żeby zdobyć sławę”.
links.belarusian: "*Заслугоўваюць* на пакаранне за ўсе гэтыя рэчы, якія мусілі зрабіць, каб атрымаць славу".

links.title: Annette: ""Okay..." She coughs. "Maybe buy so..."
links.english: "Okay..." She coughs. "Maybe buy some books then?"
links.polish: „Aha...” – chrząka. „A może kupi pan jakieś książki?”
links.belarusian: "Ага..." – хрыпіць. "А можа купіце нейкія кнігі?"

links.title: You: ""So I can absorb their *essence*. A..."
links.english: "So I can absorb their *essence*. All their fame will flow into me."
links.polish: „Żebym mógł wchłonąć ich *esencję*. Cała ich sława przejdzie na mnie”.
links.belarusian: "Каб я мог увабраць іх *сутнасць*. Уся іх слава пяройдзе да мяне".

links.title: Annette: ""I don't think that's how fame work..."
links.english: "I don't think that's how fame works, sir..."
links.polish: „Sława chyba tak nie działa, psze pana...”
links.belarusian: "Слава, напэўна, так не працуе, спадару..."

links.title: You: ""Haha, never mind, girl. I'm quite..."
links.english: "Haha, never mind, girl. I'm quite the joker. I would never do something like that."
links.polish: „Ha, ha, nieważne, dziecko. Taki ze mnie żartowniś. W życiu bym czegoś takiego nie zrobił”.
links.belarusian: "Ха, ха, не важна, дзіцятка. З мяне такі жартун. Ніколі ў жыцці нічога такога б не зрабіў".

links.title: Annette: ""That's not a funny joke. At all.""
links.english: "That's not a funny joke. At all."
links.polish: „Bardzo nieśmieszny żart. Ani trochę”.
links.belarusian: "Вельмі несмешны жарт. Ні кроплі".

links.title: You: ""Never mind... I literally had noth..."
links.english: "Never mind... I literally had nothing else to say."
links.polish: „Nieważne... Nie mam dosłownie nic więcej do powiedzenia”.
links.belarusian: "Не важна... У мяне літаральна няма больш нічога да сказання".

links.title: Annette: ""Okay!" She looks at you with her w..."
links.english: "Okay!" She looks at you with her wide eyes.
links.polish: „Dobrze!” – patrzy na ciebie szeroko otwartymi oczami.
links.belarusian: "Добра!" – глядзіць на цябе шырока расчыненымі вачыма.

links.title: You: ""Right, I had a different question..."
links.english: "Right, I had a different question in mind."
links.polish: „No dobrze, chodzi mi po głowie jeszcze inne pytanie”.
links.belarusian: "Ну добра, у мяне ў галаве яшчэ адно пытанне".

links.title: You: ""Can I become famous by reading one..."
links.english: "Can I become famous by reading one of those books?"
links.polish: „A mógłbym stać się sławny, gdybym przeczytał jedną z tych książek?”
links.belarusian: "А мог бы я стаць вядомым, калі б прачытаў адну з гэтых кніг?"

links.title: Annette: ""I don't know about that... But I i..."
links.english: "I don't know about that... But I imagine life is great when you're famous."
links.polish: „Tego nie wiem... Ale życie musi być wspaniałe, kiedy jest się sławnym”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта я не ведаю... Але жыццё павінна быць цудоўным, калі ты знакаміты".

links.title: You: ""Who is that?" (Point to the woman..."
links.english: "Who is that?" (Point to the woman browsing books.)
links.polish: „Kto to jest?” (Wskaż na przeglądającą książki kobietę).
links.belarusian: "Хто гэта?" (Пакажыце на жанчыну, якая глядзіць кнігі).

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, that's auntie Billie. She's ni..."
links.english: "Oh, that's auntie Billie. She's nice, if a bit distressed."
links.polish: „Och, to ciocia Billie. Jest miła, tylko trochę zmartwiona”.
links.belarusian: "О, гэта цётка Білы. Яна добрая, толькі крыху занепакоеная".

links.title: You: ""She's your aunt?""
links.english: "She's your aunt?"
links.polish: „To twoja ciotka?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта твая цётка?"

links.title: Annette: ""No-no, sir. She's a working woman..."
links.english: "No-no, sir. She's a working woman who comes to look at the books a lot."
links.polish: „Nie, nie, psze pana. To pani pracująca, która często przychodzi pooglądać książki”.
links.belarusian: "Не, не, пане. Гэта рабочая дама, якая часта прыходзіць паглядзець кнігі".

links.title: You: ""Why is she distressed?""
links.english: "Why is she distressed?"
links.polish: „Czemu jest zmartwiona?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму яна засмучаная?"

links.title: Annette: ""I think she has a bad husband. Not..."
links.english: "I think she has a bad husband. Not very nice or helpful."
links.polish: „Chyba ma złego męża. Nie jest miły i jej nie pomaga”.
links.belarusian: "Мабыць, у яе дрэнны муж. Ён не ветлівы і ёй не дапамагае".

links.title: You: ""You can stop calling me 'sir.' I a..."
links.english: "You can stop calling me 'sir.' I am but a working man."
links.polish: „Nie musisz mi mówić per »pan«. Jestem tylko członkiem klasy pracującej”.
links.belarusian: "Не трэба звяртацца да мяне на "пан". Я ўсяго толькі член працоўнага класа".

links.title: Annette: ""No, sir, I can't. It would be too..."
links.english: "No, sir, I can't. It would be too tiring to refrain from it. It's already tiring enough to remember to say it all the time. It's nice of you to say I could stop, though."
links.polish: „Nie, psze pana, nie mogę. Pamiętanie o tym to byłby za duży wysiłek. Już dość męczące jest pamiętanie, żeby zawsze to dodawać. Ale to miło z pana strony”.
links.belarusian: "Не, спадар, не магу. Запамінаць гэта было б занадта цяжка. І так ужо дастаткова цяжка памятаць, каб заўсёды гэта дадаваць. Але гэта міла з вашага боку".

links.title: You: ""I get you. I, for example, can't s..."
links.english: "I get you. I, for example, can't stop making this face." (Point at your face.)
links.polish: „Rozumiem cię. Ja na przykład nie mogę przestać robić tej miny”. (Wskaż na swoją twarz).
links.belarusian: "Я цябе разумею. Я, напрыклад, не магу перастаць рабіць гэты выраз твару". (Пакажы на сваё твар).

links.title: Annette: ""That's a friendly enough face, mos..."
links.english: "That's a friendly enough face, most of the time."
links.polish: „Jest całkiem sympatyczna, tak jakby”.
links.belarusian: "Яна даволі сімпатычная, так бы мовіць".

links.title: You: ""Okay, yeah, when the next person c..."
links.english: "Okay, yeah, when the next person comes, you'd have to 'sir' or 'ma'am' them again."
links.polish: „No tak, fakt, jak przyjdzie następna osoba, znów będziesz musiała mówić »pan« czy »pani«”.
links.belarusian: "Ну так, факт, як прыйдзе наступная асоба, зноў давядзецца гаварыць "спадар" ці "спадарыня"".

links.title: Annette: ""Yes... sir." She smiles apologetic..."
links.english: "Yes... sir." She smiles apologetically.
links.polish: „Właśnie... psze pana” – uśmiecha się przepraszająco.
links.belarusian: "Вось... пані", — выбачаецца, усміхаючыся.

links.title: You: ""'Sir' it is, then. Soldier on.""
links.english: "'Sir' it is, then. Soldier on."
links.polish: „Dobrze, w takim razie niech będzie i »pan«. Bądź dzielna”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, у такім выпадку будзе і "пан". Будзь адважнай".

links.title: Annette: ""By your command!""
links.english: "By your command!"
links.polish: „Na rozkaz!”
links.belarusian: "Па загадзе!"

links.title: You: ""Okay, I'm going to *deduce* someth..."
links.english: "Okay, I'm going to *deduce* something now."
links.polish: „Dobra, teraz coś *wydedukuję*”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, зараз нешта *вывяду*".

links.title: Composure: "The girl keeps her hands folded, hi..."
links.english: The girl keeps her hands folded, hidden. Why is that?
links.polish: Dziewczynka ma splecione dłonie, ukrywa je. Czemu?
links.belarusian: Дзяўчынка мае сцятыя рукі, хавае іх. Чаму?

links.title: You: ""Hey... Why do you keep your hands..."
links.english: "Hey... Why do you keep your hands folded?"
links.polish: „Hej... Czemu masz ciągle splecione dłonie?”
links.belarusian: "Гэй... Чаму ў цябе заўсёды складзеныя рукі?"

links.title: Annette: ""What do you mean, sir?" She looks..."
links.english: "What do you mean, sir?" She looks wary.
links.polish: „Nie rozumiem, psze pana” – przybiera czujną postawę.
links.belarusian: "Не разумею, спадару" – прымае асцярожную паставу.

links.title: Empathy: "She knows where this is going."
links.english: She knows where this is going.
links.polish: Wie, do czego to zmierza.
links.belarusian: Як, да чаго гэта вядзе.

links.title: You: ""You don't need to be worried. I'm..."
links.english: "You don't need to be worried. I'm here to help."
links.polish: „Nie musisz się martwić. Przyszedłem, żeby pomóc”.
links.belarusian: "Не трэба турбавацца. Я прыйшоў, каб дапамагчы".

links.title: Annette: "She looks around anxiously. Her han..."
links.english: She looks around anxiously. Her hands remain folded in front of her. She doesn't want to show them.
links.polish: Rozgląda się nerwowo. Dłonie nadal ma splecione. Nie chce ich pokazać.
links.belarusian: Аглядваецца нервова. Рукі ўсё яшчэ сплецены. Не хоча іх паказваць.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant stands by -- looking..."
links.english: The lieutenant stands by -- looking at the two of you with little interest.
links.polish: Porucznik stoi w pobliżu i przygląda się waszej dwójce z niewielkim zainteresowaniem.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант стаіць паблізу і назірае за вамі абодвума з невялікай цікавасцю.

links.title: Empathy: "A façade of true professionalism. H..."
links.english: A façade of true professionalism. He is far more intrigued by the situation than his poise reveals.
links.polish: Fasada prawdziwego profesjonalizmu. Jest o wiele bardziej zaintrygowany tą sytuacją, niż wskazywałaby jego powierzchowność.
links.belarusian: Фасад сапраўднага прафесіяналізму. Ён значна больш заінтрыгаваны гэтай сітуацыяй, чым сведчыць яго павярхоўнасць.

links.title: You: ""It's okay.""
links.english: "It's okay."
links.polish: „Nie bój się”.
links.belarusian: "Не бойся".

links.title: You: ""You heard me. Hands up.""
links.english: "You heard me. Hands up."
links.polish: „Słyszałaś, co mówię. Pokaż dłonie”.
links.belarusian: "Ты чул, што я кажу. Пакажы рукі".

links.title: You: ""You can show them to me.""
links.english: "You can show them to me."
links.polish: „Możesz mi je pokazać”.
links.belarusian: "Можаш мне іх паказаць".

links.title: You: ""Actually, I'd rather not deduce an..."
links.english: "Actually, I'd rather not deduce anything. Every time I deduce people get hurt."
links.polish: „Właściwie to wolałbym niczego nie dedukować. Zawsze, kiedy to robię, komuś dzieje się krzywda”.
links.belarusian: "Сапраўды, я б лепш нічога не вызначаў. Кожны раз, калі я гэта раблю, камусьці робіцца балюча".

links.title: Annette: "She sighs -- not relieved, but resi..."
links.english: She sighs -- not relieved, but resigned. "No," she says. "You're right..."
links.polish: Wzdycha, nie z ulgą, a raczej kapitulując. „Nie” – odpowiada. „Ma pan rację...”
links.belarusian: Уздыхае, не з палёгкай, а хутчэй капітулюючы. "Не," - адказвае. "Вы маеце рацыю..."

links.title: Annette: "She brings out her reddened hands -..."
links.english: She brings out her reddened hands -- her nails are frayed, nearly chewed down to the flesh.
links.polish: Wyciąga zaczerwienione dłonie. Jej paznokcie są połamane, obgryzione niemal do ciała.
links.belarusian: Яна выцягвае чырвоныя рукі. Яе пазногці зламаныя, абгрызены амаль да цела.

links.title: You: ""You bite your nails.""
links.english: "You bite your nails."
links.polish: „Obgryzasz paznokcie”.
links.belarusian: "Абгрызаеш пазногці".

links.title: Annette: ""And you knew this from me keeping..."
links.english: "And you knew this from me keeping my hands folded?" She shoots you a suspicious glance.
links.polish: „Domyślił się pan po moich złożonych dłoniach?” – rzuca ci podejrzliwe spojrzenie.
links.belarusian: "Вы здагадаліся па маіх складаных руках?" – кідае вам падазроны погляд.

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: Annette: ""Well... that proves nothing! Anyon..."
links.english: "Well... that proves nothing! Anyone could do an easy deduction like that!" Her eyes flash with defiance. She's not impressed.
links.polish: „No... to żaden dowód! Każdy może wydedukować taką prostą rzecz!” – w jej oczach pojawia się błysk zuchwałości. Wyraźnie nie jest pod wrażeniem twojego procesu myślowego.
links.belarusian: "Не... гэта не доказ! Кожны можа прыйсці да такой простай высновы!" — у яе вачах мільгае зухаваты агеньчык. Яна яўна не ўражаная тваім мысленнем.

links.title: Suggestion: "She actually is impressed, this is..."
links.english: She actually is impressed, this is more like a defensive reflex.
links.polish: Tak naprawdę jest pod wrażeniem. To tylko odruch obronny.
links.belarusian: На самой справе ён уражаны. Гэта проста абаронны рэфлекс.

links.title: You: ""Want more? Bet I can figure out *w..."
links.english: "Want more? Bet I can figure out *why* you bite your nails. I got a few reasons in mind."
links.polish: „Chcesz więcej? Na pewno zdołam dojść, *dlaczego* obgryzasz paznokcie. Mam już kilka pomysłów”.
links.belarusian: "Хочаш больш? Я ўпэўнены, што змагу даведацца, *чаму* ты абгрызаеш пазногці. Ужо ёсць некалькі ідэй".

links.title: Annette: "She nods -- half provocative, half..."
links.english: She nods -- half provocative, half enthusiastic.
links.polish: Przytakuje, w czym dostrzegasz rozbawienie i prowokację.
links.belarusian: Ківаю, у чым заўважаеш пацеху і правакацыю.

links.title: You: ""You're uptight because of your mot..."
links.english: "You're uptight because of your mother and the pressure she's putting on you."
links.polish: „Jesteś zestresowana ze względu na twoją matkę i presję, jaką na tobie wywiera”.
links.belarusian: "Ты знаходзішся пад стрэсам з-за сваёй маці і ціску, які яна на цябе аказвае".

links.title: Annette: "Dismay flickers in her eyes. "Maybe..."
links.english: Dismay flickers in her eyes. "Maybe so, sir." She sighs. "Okay, I know, it's a bad habit and I shouldn't."
links.polish: Jej spojrzenie zdradza konsternację. „Może tak, psze pana” – wzdycha. „No dobrze, wiem, że to brzydki nawyk i nie powinnam”.
links.belarusian: Яе позір выдае замяшанне. "Можа так, гаспадару" — уздыхае. "Ну добра, ведаю, што гэта дрэнная звычка і не павінна".

links.title: You: ""Either way, another *ace* deductio..."
links.english: "Either way, another *ace* deduction by the #1 detective in town."
links.polish: „Tak czy tak, oto i kolejna godna *asa* dedukcja najlepszego detektywa w mieście”.
links.belarusian: "Так ці так, вось і чарговы годны *туз* дэдукцыі найлепшага дэтэктыва ў горадзе".

links.title: Annette: ""It was okay, sir." She's still got..."
links.english: "It was okay, sir." She's still got a rebellious streak.
links.polish: „Ujdzie, psze pana” – nadal jest w buntowniczym nastroju.
links.belarusian: "Прыгодзіцца, спадару", - ён усё яшчэ знаходзіцца ў бунтарскім настроі.

links.title: Composure: "There's more that can be achieved h..."
links.english: There's more that can be achieved here. Ask her to do the same.
links.polish: Możesz tu jeszcze coś osiągnąć. Poproś ją, żeby zrobiła to samo.
links.belarusian: Ты можаш яшчэ тут нешта дасягнуць. Папрасі яе зрабіць тое ж самае.

links.title: You: ""That was a master class move. What..."
links.english: "That was a master class move. Whatever, kid, I don't need to prove myself to you."
links.polish: „To był mistrzowski ruch. Zresztą wszystko jedno, dzieciaro. Nie muszę ci niczego udowadniać”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта быў майстэрскі ход. Дарэчы, усё адно, дзяўчынка. Мне не трэба табе нічога даказваць".

links.title: Annette: ""If you say so, sir." She grins vic..."
links.english: "If you say so, sir." She grins victoriously.
links.polish: „Skoro pan tak mówi” – szczerzy się triumfalnie.
links.belarusian: "Калі вы так кажаце" – усміхаецца ён трыумфальна.

links.title: You: ""I hope this entertained you.""
links.english: "I hope this entertained you."
links.polish: „Mam nadzieję, że ci się spodobało”.
links.belarusian: "Спадзяюся, што табе спадабалася".

links.title: You: ""Rats have been nibbling on your fi..."
links.english: "Rats have been nibbling on your fingers. Child labour in dismal working conditions..."
links.polish: „Szczury podgryzają ci palce. Praca dziecka w fatalnych warunkach...”
links.belarusian: "Шуркі падгразаюць табе пальцы. Праца дзіцяці ў катастрафічных умовах..."

links.title: Annette: ""What rats? I just read books. Have..."
links.english: "What rats? I just read books. Haven't seen a rat in this building in forever."
links.polish: „Jakie szczury? Ja tylko czytam książki. Nie widziałam tu szczura od nigdy”.
links.belarusian: "Якія пацукі? Я толькі чытаю кнігі. Не бачыла тут пацука ад ніколі".

links.title: You: ""No rats in this dilapidated buildi..."
links.english: "No rats in this dilapidated building? Strange."
links.polish: „Żadnych szczurów w tak zapuszczonym budynku? Dziwne”.
links.belarusian: "Ніякіх шчураў у такім заняпалым будынку? Дзіўна".

links.title: Annette: ""Maybe they're just afraid... of bo..."
links.english: "Maybe they're just afraid... of books!" She laughs, with a slight nervous undertone.
links.polish: „Może po prostu boją się... książek!” – w jej śmiechu pobrzmiewa zaniepokojenie.
links.belarusian: "Можа, яны проста баяцца... кніг!" – у яе смеху чуваць турбота.

links.title: You: ""Chewed-on-nails... means you're re..."
links.english: "Chewed-on-nails... means you're recycling your body material."
links.polish: „Obgryzione paznokcie... to jak recykling własnego ciała”.
links.belarusian: "Абгрызеныя пазногці... гэта як перапрацоўка ўласнага цела".

links.title: Annette: ""That is so gross.""
links.english: "That is so gross."
links.polish: „Ale obrzydliwe”.
links.belarusian: "Агідна".

links.title: You: ""Life is gross. So very gross.""
links.english: "Life is gross. So very gross."
links.polish: „Życie jest obrzydliwe. Strasznie obrzydliwe”.
links.belarusian: "Жыццё агіднае. Жахліва агіднае".

links.title: Annette: ""Eww." She shudders."
links.english: "Eww." She shudders.
links.polish: „Fuj” – wzdryga się.
links.belarusian: "Фу" — уздрыгвае.

links.title: You: ""It's an intense dedication to the..."
links.english: "It's an intense dedication to the Way of Business. There are no riches without personal sacrifice."
links.polish: „To przez twoje ogromne poświęcenie światu biznesu. Nie da się dojść do bogactwa bez osobistych poświęceń”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта з-за вашай вялікай адданасці дзелавому свету. Нельга дасягнуць багацця без асабістых ахвяраў".

links.title: Annette: ""Thank you, sir! I work hard." She..."
links.english: "Thank you, sir! I work hard." She beams a smile.
links.polish: „Dziękuję panu! Ciężko pracuję” – rozpromienia się.
links.belarusian: "Дзякую пану! Цяжка працую" — ззяе яна.

links.title: You: ""You think so? Fine, do better -- d..."
links.english: "You think so? Fine, do better -- deduce something about me."
links.polish: „Tak myślisz? Dobra, to pokaż mi. Wydedukuj coś o mnie”.
links.belarusian: "Ты так думаеш? Добра, тады пакажы мне. Зрабі вывад пра мяне".

links.title: Annette: ""You're quite sober." She snaps bac..."
links.english: "You're quite sober." She snaps back quickly.
links.polish: „Jest pan całkiem trzeźwy” – rzuca szybko.
links.belarusian: "Вы зусім цвярозы" — хутка прамовіў ён.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant does not flinch at t..."
links.english: The lieutenant does not flinch at the comment. He does not flinch even a single bit. He is intensely not flinching. It takes effort.
links.polish: Porucznik nawet nie drgnął, słysząc ten komentarz. Nie drgnął nawet odrobinę. Skupia całą swoją wolę, aby nie drgać. Wymaga to od niego wysiłku.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант аніводнага разу не варухнуўся, пачуўшы гэты каментар. Не варухнуўся нават крыху. Ён канцэнтруе ўсю сваю волю, каб не варушыцца. Гэта патрабуе ад яго намаганняў.

links.title: You: ""Wait... How do you know I'm usuall..."
links.english: "Wait... How do you know I'm usually not?"
links.polish: „Zaraz. Skąd wiesz, że zazwyczaj nie jestem?”
links.belarusian: "Пачакай. Адкуль ты ведаеш, што я звычайна не?"

links.title: Annette: ""Because you usually aren't.""
links.english: "Because you usually aren't."
links.polish: „Bo zazwyczaj pan nie jest”.
links.belarusian: "Бо звычайна пан не з'яўляецца".

links.title: You: ""Yeah, about that... maybe you coul..."
links.english: "Yeah, about that... maybe you could point me toward some booze?"
links.polish: „A, właśnie... Wiesz może, gdzie znajdę trochę gorzały?”
links.belarusian: "А, дарэчы... Ты ведаеш, дзе можна знайсці крыху гарэлкі?"

links.title: Annette: ""Uhm... Frittte, maybe?" She shrugs..."
links.english: "Uhm... Frittte, maybe?" She shrugs, a compassionate look in her eyes. "Alcohol is not good for you, sir."
links.polish: „Uch... może we Frittte?” – wzrusza ramionami ze współczuciem w oczach. „Alkohol tylko panu zaszkodzi”.
links.belarusian: "Ух... можа ў Фрыттэ?" – паціскае плячыма з суспачуваннем у вачах. "Алкаголь толькі пашкодзіць вам".

links.title: Annette: "There she stands, swaying on her fe..."
links.english: There she stands, swaying on her feet, assaulted by the early spring breeze. She smiles at you. The whole situation suddenly feels familiar, somehow.
links.polish: I tak stoi, kołysząc się na stopach, napastowana przez podmuchy wczesnowiosennego wiatru. Uśmiecha się do ciebie. Nagle cała ta scena wydaje ci się dziwnie znajoma.
links.belarusian: І так стаіць, гайдаючыся на насках, пад уплывам подыхаў раннявясенні ветру. Усміхаецца да цябе. Раптам уся гэта сцэна здаецца табе дзіўна знаёмай.

links.title: Logic: "There's something you're missing..."
links.english: There's something you're missing...
links.polish: Czegoś tu nie dostrzegasz...
links.belarusian: Чагось ты тут не заўважаеш...

links.title: You: ""And I'm having a grand time!""
links.english: "And I'm having a grand time!"
links.polish: „I jest mi z tym doskonale!”
links.belarusian: "І мне з гэтым цудоўна!"

links.title: Annette: ""I sure hope you are, sir!" She rub..."
links.english: "I sure hope you are, sir!" She rubs her red nose.
links.polish: „Mam nadzieję, psze pana!” – pociera swój zaczerwieniony nos.
links.belarusian: "Спадзяюся, спадар!" – церці свой пачырванелы нос.

links.title: You: ""I am also sad and my head hurts.""
links.english: "I am also sad and my head hurts."
links.polish: „Jestem też smutny i boli mnie głowa”.
links.belarusian: "Я таксама сумны і мая галава баліць".

links.title: Annette: ""I'm sorry, sir. I hope things get..."
links.english: "I'm sorry, sir. I hope things get better soon." She looks you in the eye, a gleam of sympathy on her face.
links.polish: „Przykro mi, psze pana. Mam nadzieję, że wszystko się ułoży” – gdy patrzy ci w oczy, na jej twarzy maluje się współczucie.
links.belarusian: "Прабачце, спадар. Спадзяюся, што ўсё ўладзіцца" — калі глядзіць вам у вочы, на яе твары чытаецца спачуванне.

links.title: You: ""There were a few other hints...""
links.english: "There were a few other hints..."
links.polish: „Było kilka innych poszlak...”
links.belarusian: "Было некалькі іншых намёкаў..."

links.title: You: ""It's super simple for a detective..."
links.english: "It's super simple for a detective such as myself."
links.polish: „To łatwizna dla takiego detektywa jak ja”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта простая справа для такога дэтэктыва, як я".

links.title: Composure: "You fail to deduce anything substan..."
links.english: You fail to deduce anything substantial.
links.polish: Nie udaje ci się wydedukować niczego konkretnego.
links.belarusian: Вам не ўдаецца высветліць нічога канкрэтнага.

links.title: Annette: "She waits intently."
links.english: She waits intently.
links.polish: Czeka w skupieniu.
links.belarusian: Чакае ў засяроджанасці.

links.title: You: ""I'm a detective. I deduce that you..."
links.english: "I'm a detective. I deduce that you... are a girl."
links.polish: „Jestem detektywem. Wydedukowałem, że... jesteś dziewczynką”.
links.belarusian: "Я дэтэктыў. Я прыйшоў да высновы, што... ты дзяўчынка".

links.title: Annette: ""Come on, anyone would notice that!..."
links.english: "Come on, anyone would notice that!" She rolls her eyes.
links.polish: „Bez przesady, to od razu widać!” – przewraca oczami.
links.belarusian: "Без перабольшвання, гэта адразу відаць!" — крышыць вачыма.

links.title: You: ""I'm a detective. I deduce that......"
links.english: "I'm a detective. I deduce that... You are very small."
links.polish: „Jestem detektywem. Wydedukowałem, że... jesteś bardzo mała”.
links.belarusian: "Я дэтэктыў. Я зрабіў выснову, што... ты вельмі маленькая".

links.title: Annette: ""Come on, don't be silly. That's no..."
links.english: "Come on, don't be silly. That's not a proper deduction." She rolls her eyes.
links.polish: „Proszę się nie wygłupiać. To nie jest żadna dedukcja” – przewraca oczami.
links.belarusian: "Калі ласка, не глупіце. Гэта не ніякая дэдукцыя", – закочвае вочы.

links.title: You: ""Actually, I... I... I'm sorry... I..."
links.english: "Actually, I... I... I'm sorry... I can't deduce anything.
links.polish: „Właściwie, to... to... przepraszam, ale... nie umiem niczego wydedukować”.
links.belarusian: "Уласна кажучы, гэта… гэта… прабачце, але… я не ўмею нічога вызначыць".

links.title: Annette: "A small disappointment rolls over h..."
links.english: A small disappointment rolls over her, but she promptly gets over it and says: "It's okay, sir."
links.polish: Szybko rozprawia się z tym przypływem rozczarowania i mówi: „Nic nie szkodzi, psze pana”.
links.belarusian: Хутка справіўшыся з прылівам расчаравання, ён кажа: "Нічога страшнага, спадар".

links.title: Empathy: "You disappointed a small child. Wel..."
links.english: You disappointed a small child. Well done, champ.
links.polish: Rozczarowałeś małą dziewczynkę. Świetna robota, stary.
links.belarusian: Ты расчараваў маленькую дзяўчынку. Выдатная праца, стары.

links.title: You: "What are you missing here? Why does..."
links.english: What are you missing here? Why does this feel familiar?
links.polish: Co tu jest nie halo? Czemu wydaje mi się to znajome?
links.belarusian: Што тут не так? Чаму мне гэта здаецца знаёмым?

links.title: Suggestion: "Because you know each other. She's..."
links.english: Because you know each other. She's been talking to you so openly because you've talked before.
links.polish: Bo się znacie. Rozmawia z tobą tak otwarcie, bo robiła to już wcześniej.
links.belarusian: Бо вы ведаецеся. Размаўляе з табой так адкрыта, бо рабіла гэта ўжо раней.

links.title: You: ""Hang on. So you... know me? We've..."
links.english: "Hang on. So you... know me? We've met before?"
links.polish: „Chwila. A więc ty... mnie znasz? Spotkaliśmy się wcześniej?”
links.belarusian: "Момант. Дык ты... мяне ведаеш? Мы сустракаліся раней?"

links.title: Annette: ""Yes! I used to stand out there all..."
links.english: "Yes! I used to stand out there all the time, before mother told me to focus on my homework."
links.polish: „Tak! Stałam tam bez przerwy, póki mama nie kazała mi przyłożyć się do lekcji”.
links.belarusian: "Так! Я стаяла там без перапынку, пакуль мама не загадала мне ўзяцца за ўрокі".

links.title: Annette: ""You've been running around for sev..."
links.english: "You've been running around for several days, talking about small churches and how everyone betrayed you, sir."
links.polish: „Przez kilka dni biegał pan po okolicy i mówił coś o jakichś małych kościołach i że wszyscy pana zdradzili”.
links.belarusian: "На працягу некалькіх дзён вы бегаеце па акрузе і казалі нешта аб нейкіх малых касцёлах і што ўсе вас здрадзілі".

Alternate1.english: "You've been running around all week without your shirt on, sir. Telling people about being a star or something. I don't really understand who those stars are..."
Alternate1.polish: „Przez cały tydzień biegał pan po okolicy bez koszulki. Mówił pan, że jest gwiazdą czy coś. Nie wiem, co pan miał na myśli...”
Alternate1.belarusian: "Увесь тыдзень вы бегалі па наваколлі без кашулі. Вы казалі, што вы зорка ці нешта такое. Не ведаю, што вы мелі на ўвазе..."

Alternate2.english: "You've been running around all week without your shirt on, sir. Telling people the end of the world is coming. I don't really understand what you mean by it..."
Alternate2.polish: „Przez cały tydzień biegał pan po okolicy bez koszulki. Mówił pan, że nadchodzi koniec świata. Nie wiem, co pan miał na myśli...”
Alternate2.belarusian: "Увесь тыдзень вы бегалі па акрузе без кашулі. Казалі, што надыходзіць канец свету. Не ведаю, што вы мелі на ўвазе..."

Alternate3.english: "You've been running around all week without your shirt on, sir. Apologizing to everyone. I don't really understand what you've done wrong..."
Alternate3.polish: „Przez cały tydzień biegał pan po okolicy bez koszulki. Wszystkich pan przepraszał. Nie wiem, co takiego złego pan zrobił...”
Alternate3.belarusian: "Праз увесь тыдзень вы бегалі па раёне без кашулі. Усіх вы прасілі прабачэння. Не ведаю, што такога кепскага вы зрабілі..."

Alternate4.english: "You've been running around all week, sir. Sometimes without your shirt on -- asking people questions. I haven't really understood what about..."
Alternate4.polish: „Przez cały tydzień biegał pan po okolicy. Czasem bez koszulki. Zadawał pan ludziom różne pytania. Nie zrozumiałam, o co właściwie pan pytał...”
Alternate4.belarusian: "Увесь тыдзень вы бегалі па ваколіцах. Часам без кашулі. Вы задавалі людзям розныя пытанні. Я не зразумела, пра што менавіта вы пыталіся..."

links.title: You: ""Did I ever talk to you?""
links.english: "Did I ever talk to you?"
links.polish: „Czy my już kiedyś rozmawialiśmy?”
links.belarusian: "Ці мы ўжо калі-небудзь размаўлялі?"

links.title: Annette: ""Of course. You stopped by a few ti..."
links.english: "Of course. You stopped by a few times." She looks at you intently. "You certainly look better than the last time I saw you!"
links.polish: „Oczywiście. Był pan tu kilka razy” – przygląda ci się uważnie. „Teraz wygląda pan zdecydowanie lepiej niż ostatnio!”
links.belarusian: "Вядома. Вы былі тут некалькі разоў", – уважліва глядзіць на вас. "Цяпер вы выглядаеце значна лепш, чым апошні раз!"

links.title: You: ""I doubt that.""
links.english: "I doubt that."
links.polish: „Jakoś w to wątpię”.
links.belarusian: "Нейкім чынам сумняваюся ў гэтым".

links.title: Annette: ""No, you don't have party eyes anym..."
links.english: "No, you don't have party eyes anymore."
links.polish: „Nie, nie ma pan już imprezowych oczu”.
links.belarusian: "Не, у вас ужо няма вечарынкавых вачэй".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant slowly -- ever so sl..."
links.english: The lieutenant slowly -- ever so slowly -- realizes something. "Party eyes. Yes, of course. That makes sense."
links.polish: Porucznik powoli – bardzo powoli – coś sobie uświadamia. „Imprezowe oczy. Tak, oczywiście. To ma sens”.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант павольна – вельмі павольна – нешта ўсведамляе. "Вечарынкавыя вочы. Так, вядома. Гэта мае сэнс".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I'm not surprised children have see..."
links.english: I'm not surprised children have seen you running around with *party eyes* on, he thinks. Not at all.
links.polish: Nie jestem zdziwiony, że dzieci widziały cię biegającego po okolicy z *imprezowymi oczami* – myśli. Ani trochę.
links.belarusian: Я не здзіўляюся, што дзеці бачылі цябе, які бегае па ваколіцах з *вечарынкавымі вачыма* — думае. Ні кроплі.

links.title: You: ""*Party eyes*?""
links.english: "*Party eyes*?"
links.polish: „*Imprezowych oczu*?”
links.belarusian: "*Вечарынкавыя вочы*?"

links.title: Annette: ""You know... like a cat in the dark..."
links.english: "You know... like a cat in the dark! All big-and-wide-eyed." She giggles at the thought. "It certainly looks odd on a man."
links.polish: „Wie pan... jak kot w ciemności! Wielgachne” – chichocze na myśl o tym. „Człowiek śmiesznie z takimi wygląda”.
links.belarusian: "Ведаеце... як кот у цемры! Велізарныя" – пасмейваецца, думаючы пра гэта. "Чалавек выглядае смешна з такімі".

links.title: Composure: "The swivelling eyes of a loony drug..."
links.english: The swivelling eyes of a loony drug addict. That is what she meant. You were probably gurning too.
links.polish: Rozbiegane oczy szurniętego narkomana. To miała na myśli. Pewnie miałeś też tiki.
links.belarusian: Разбеганыя вочы шалёнага наркамана. Гэта яна мела на ўвазе. Напэўна, у цябе таксама былі тыкі.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Good thing she's didn't say PARTY E..."
links.english: Good thing she's didn't say PARTY EYES loud, her mother's nearby...
links.polish: Dobrze, że nie powiedziała o tych *imprezowych oczach* głośniej. Jej matka jest niedaleko...
links.belarusian: Добра, што яна не сказала пра гэтыя *вечарковыя вочы* гучней. Яе маці недалёка...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Fuck yeah! You should get some part..."
links.english: Fuck yeah! You should get some party eyes right now! Snap those sequins on you, boy.
links.polish: Tak jest, kurwa! Teraz też by ci się przydały takie imprezowe oczy! Jak naklejone cekiny, chłopaku.
links.belarusian: Вось так, блін! Цяпер табе таксама спатрэбяцца такія вечаровыя вочы! Як наклееныя пайетки, хлопча.

links.title: You: "Does that mean... I've been partaki..."
links.english: Does that mean... I've been partaking in *narcotics*?
links.polish: Czy to znaczy... że zażywałem *narkotyki*?
links.belarusian: Ці гэта значыць... што я прымаў *наркотыкі*?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Oh baby, that's not what you have t..."
links.english: Oh baby, that's not what you have to worry about. Worry about the important thing!
links.polish: Och, słoneczko, nie tym powinieneś się martwić. Jest jedna ważniejsza rzecz!
links.belarusian: Ох, сонейка, не гэтым ты павінен турбавацца. Ёсць адна больш важная рэч!

links.title: You: "The girl doesn't know what she's ta..."
links.english: The girl doesn't know what she's talking about! Forget about this.
links.polish: Dziewczyna nie wie nawet, o czym mówi! Daj spokój.
links.belarusian: Дзяўчына нават не ведае, аб чым гаворыць! Кіньце.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Don't leave us hanging like that, m..."
links.english: Don't leave us hanging like that, man. Open yourself to the experiences of the world, expand your consciousness. With amphetamines.
links.polish: No nie zostawiaj nas w takim stanie, stary. Otwórz się na doświadczenie świata, poszerz swoją świadomość. Najlepiej amfetaminą.
links.belarusian: Не пакідай нас у такім стане, стары. Адкрыйся на досвед свету, пашыры сваю свядомасць. Лепш за ўсё амфетамінам.

links.title: You: ""So... why didn't you tell me you k..."
links.english: "So... why didn't you tell me you knew me to begin with?"
links.polish: „To... czemu od razu mi nie powiedziałaś, że mnie znasz?”
links.belarusian: "То... чаму адразу не сказала мне, што мяне ведаеш?"
