links.title: Annette: ""I didn't know I had to do that." S..."
links.english: "I didn't know I had to do that." She looks puzzled.
links.polish: „Nie wiedziałam, że tak trzeba” – wygląda na zdziwioną.
links.belarusian: "Я не ведала, што так трэба" — выглядае здзіўленай.

links.title: You: ""I don't really like this detective..."
links.english: "I don't really like this detective-deduction game anymore..." (Conclude.)
links.polish: „Przestała mi się już podobać ta zabawa w dedukcję...” (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: "Мне ўжо перастала падабацца гэтая забава ў дэдукцыю…" (Скончы).

links.title: Annette: "She gives you a rather concerned lo..."
links.english: She gives you a rather concerned look. "I guess we can change the subject, sir. I didn't mean to bring you down."
links.polish: Spogląda na ciebie pełnym zaniepokojenia wzrokiem. „To może zmieńmy temat, psze pana. Nie chciałam pana zdołować”.
links.belarusian: Глядзіць на цябе вачамі, поўнымі трывогі. "Можа, зменім тэму, пане. Не хацела вас засмуціць".

links.title: You: ""Thanks -- I've learned something a..."
links.english: "Thanks -- I've learned something about myself today." (Conclude.)
links.polish: „Dziękuję. Czegoś się dzisiaj o sobie nauczyłem”. (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй. Сёння я нешта пра сябе даведаўся". (Скончы).

links.title: Annette: ""I'm glad I could help you, sir." S..."
links.english: "I'm glad I could help you, sir." She smiles a wide, helpful smile.
links.polish: „Cieszę się, że pomogłam, psze pana” – na jej twarzy rozlewa się szeroki, pełen życzliwości uśmiech.
links.belarusian: "Я рада, што дапамагла, спадар" — шырокая, поўная дабрыні ўсмешка распасціраецца на яе твары.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean better? I look li..."
links.english: "What do you mean better? I look like shit."
links.polish: „Jak to lepiej? Wyglądam koszmarnie”.
links.belarusian: "Як гэта лепш? Выглядаю жахліва".

links.title: Annette: ""Yeah, but you don't have party eye..."
links.english: "Yeah, but you don't have party eyes anymore."
links.polish: „Tak, ale nie ma pan już imprezowych oczu”.
links.belarusian: "Так, але ў вас ужо няма вечарынкавых вачэй".

links.title: You: ""Thanks. I'm trying.""
links.english: "Thanks. I'm trying."
links.polish: „Dzięki. Staram się”.
links.belarusian: "Дзякуй. Стараюся".

links.title: Annette: ""Yeah, I can see. You don't have pa..."
links.english: "Yeah, I can see. You don't have party eyes anymore."
links.polish: „Tak, widzę. Nie ma pan już imprezowych oczu”.
links.belarusian: "Так, бачу. У вас больш не засталося вачэй для вечарынак".

links.title: Annette: ""Yes! I stand in this spot all the..."
links.english: "Yes! I stand in this spot all the time." She sways back and forth on her feet.
links.polish: „Tak! Zawsze stoję w tym miejscu” – kołysze się w przód i w tył.
links.belarusian: "Так! Я заўсёды стаю на гэтым месцы" — гайдаецца наперад і назад.

links.title: You: ""On second thought, maybe I shouldn..."
links.english: "On second thought, maybe I shouldn't remember. Maybe there's a reason I forgot."
links.polish: „Z drugiej strony, może nie powinienem sobie tego przypominać? Może nie bez powodu zapomniałem?”
links.belarusian: "З іншага боку, можа, не варта сабе гэтага нагадваць? Можа, не без прычыны забыўся?"

links.title: Annette: ""Yes, sir." The girl looks at you q..."
links.english: "Yes, sir." The girl looks at you quizzically. "Maybe you are interested in books?"
links.polish: „Może tak, psze pana” – dziewczynka patrzy na ciebie pytająco. „Może interesują pana książki?”
links.belarusian: "Можа так, паважаны пане," — дзяўчынка глядзіць на вас пытліва. "Можа, вас цікавяць кнігі?"

links.title: Suggestion: "You have absolutely no idea. Famili..."
links.english: You have absolutely no idea. Familiar how? You must have forgotten something you heard again.
links.polish: Nie masz zielonego pojęcia. W jaki sposób znajome? Musiałeś znowu zapomnieć coś, co już kiedyś słyszałeś.
links.belarusian: Ты не маеш зялёнага паняцця. Як знаёма? Ты мусіў зноў забыць нешта, што ўжо калісьці чуў.

links.title: You: ""I gotta go." [Leave]"
links.english: "I gotta go." [Leave]
links.polish: „Muszę iść”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Я павінен ісці". [Адыдзі].

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""I'm sorry, sir, I can't talk right..."
dialogueTree.english: "I'm sorry, sir, I can't talk right now. I'm very busy with my homework... I have so much homework now."
dialogueTree.polish: „Przepraszam pana, nie mogę teraz rozmawiać. Jestem bardzo zajęta pracą domową... Strasznie dużo nam zadają”.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Прабачце, я не магу зараз размаўляць. Я вельмі занятая хатнімі заданнямі... Жудасна шмат нам задаюць".

links.title: Empathy: "You just can't win."
links.english: You just can't win.
links.polish: Chyba tego nie wygrasz.
links.belarusian: Напэўна, ты гэтага не выйграеш.

links.title: Logic: "Out of the rain and into the gutter..."
links.english: Out of the rain and into the gutter.
links.polish: Z deszczu pod rynnę.
links.belarusian: З дажджу пад канаўку.

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Hello, sir. How is the investigati..."
dialogueTree.english: "Hello, sir. How is the investigation going? Found any *cuuurses* yet?"
dialogueTree.polish: „O, to pan. Jak śledztwo? Znalazł pan już jakieś *kląąątwy*?”
dialogueTree.belarusian: "О, гэта вы. Як расследаванне? Ці знайшлі вы ўжо нейкія *праклёны*?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I found a way into the Doome..."
links.english: "Yeah, I found a way into the Doomed Commercial Area."
links.polish: „Tak, znalazłem wejście do Zgubionej Strefy Handlowej”.
links.belarusian: "Так, я знайшоў уваход у Загубленую Гандлёвую Зону".

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, that's great!" Her smile is wa..."
links.english: "Oh, that's great!" Her smile is warm. "I hope exciting adventures lie ahead! And maybe you can help mother become... less afraid."
links.polish: „O, to super!” – od jej uśmiechu bije ciepło. „Mam nadzieję, że czekają tam niezwykłe przygody! I może zrobi pan coś, żeby mama... mniej się bała”.
links.belarusian: "О, гэта цудоўна!" – ад яе ўсмешкі зыходзіць цеплыня. "Спадзяюся, што там чакаюць незвычайныя прыгоды! І, можа, вы зробіце штосьці, каб мама... менш баялася".

links.title: You: ""I can't get into the Doomed Commer..."
links.english: "I can't get into the Doomed Commercial Area. Your mother won't let me through the back door."
links.polish: „Nie mogę dostać się do Zgubionej Strefy Handlowej. Twoja matka nie chce mnie wpuścić tylnymi drzwiami”.
links.belarusian: "Я не магу трапіць у Згубленую Гандлёвую Зону. Твая маці не хоча ўпусціць мяне праз заднія дзверы".

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm. Mum can get really agitated a..."
links.english: "Mhm. Mum can get really agitated about that." She sways on her feet. "I guess you can try making her less afraid somehow... then she might trust you."
links.polish: „Mhm. Mama potrafi się o to bardzo zeźlić” – kołysze się w miejscu. „Może zrobi pan coś, żeby się mniej bała... i wtedy panu zaufa”.
links.belarusian: "Мгм. Мама можа вельмі раззлавацца з гэтага" — пагойдваецца на месцы. "Можа, вы зробіце нешта, каб яна менш баялася... і тады яна вам даверыцца".

links.title: You: ""It's going fine, I think.""
links.english: "It's going fine, I think."
links.polish: „Chyba nieźle mi idzie”.
links.belarusian: "Здаецца, у мяне даволі добра атрымліваецца."

links.title: Annette: ""That's very good to hear." She fli..."
links.english: "That's very good to hear." She flicks you a thumbs up. "You'll get to the bottom of this in no time! Just like a detective in the stories."
links.polish: „Bardzo się cieszę” – unosi kciuk. „Raz-dwa pan to rozwiąże! Jak detektyw z kryminałów”.
links.belarusian: "Вельмі рады", – падымае вялікі палец. "Раз-два вы гэта вырашыце! Як дэтэктыў з крыміналаў".

links.title: You: ""It's going bad, *really* bad.""
links.english: "It's going bad, *really* bad."
links.polish: „Idzie źle. *Bardzo* źle”.
links.belarusian: "Ідзе дрэнна. *Вельмі* дрэнна".

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, that's very sad to hear." She..."
links.english: "Oh, that's very sad to hear." She frowns. "But it'll pick up soon, don't worry. There's always a... bad spot in the stories, right before the detective figures things out."
links.polish: „Przykro mi” – zasępia się. „Ale pan się nie martwi, na pewno zaraz ruszy z kopyta. W kryminałach detektyw zawsze jest w kropce, a potem wpada na rozwiązanie”.
links.belarusian: "Прабачце", – ссумяецца ён. "Але вы не хвалюйцеся, напэўна, хутка ўсё пойдзе як па масле. У дэтэктывах следчы заўсёды трапляе ў тупік, а потым знаходзіць рашэнне".

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""The lights are so pretty when it g..."
dialogueTree.english: "The lights are so pretty when it gets dark." She scans the surrounding buildings, a happy look on her face.
dialogueTree.polish: „Światła są takie piękne, kiedy robi się ciemno” – z radosną miną omiata wzrokiem pobliskie budynki.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Святло такое прыгожае, калі цямнее" — радасна кажа, аглядаючы бліжэйшыя будынкі.

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Every snowflake is like a little g..."
dialogueTree.english: "Every snowflake is like a little gift from the sky." She shivers as one falls on her nose.
dialogueTree.polish: „Każdy płatek śniegu to jak drobny upominek od nieba”. Przechodzi ją dreszcz, gdy jeden spada jej prosto na nos.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Кожная сняжынка – гэта, быццам, дробны падарунак з неба". Яе ахоплівае дрыжыкі, калі адна з іх падае проста на нос.

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Hello again, sir!" The girl is sip..."
dialogueTree.english: "Hello again, sir!" The girl is sipping on her hot juice. She looks at you with shy amusement.
dialogueTree.polish: „O, to pan!” – dziewczynka sączy swój ciepły sok. Spogląda na ciebie z nieśmiałą wesołością.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "О, гэта вы!" – дзяўчынка пацягвае свой цёплы сок. Яна пазірае на вас з нясмелай вясёласцю.

Alternate1.english: "Hello again, sir!" You see Annette sipping on her hot juice. She looks at you with shy amusement.
Alternate1.polish: „O, to pan!” – Annette sączy swój ciepły sok. Dziewczynka spogląda na ciebie z nieśmiałą wesołością.
Alternate1.belarusian: "О, гэта вы!" — Анет ціхенька п'е свой цёплы сок. Дзяўчынка зіркае на вас з няўпэўненай весялосцю.

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Hello again, sir! Are you interest..."
dialogueTree.english: "Hello again, sir! Are you interested in a new and exciting book this time?" She sways slowly on her feet.
dialogueTree.polish: „To pan. Zapraszamy! Chciałby pan tym razem kupić nową, wciągającą książkę?” – kołysze się z wolna na stopach.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Гэта вы, спадар. Запрашаем! Ці хацелі б гэтым разам набыць новую, захапляльную кнігу?" — павольна хітаецца на нагах.

links.title: You: ""What kind of a store is this anywa..."
links.english: "What kind of a store is this anyway?"
links.polish: „Co to w ogóle jest za sklep?”
links.belarusian: "Што гэта ўвогуле за крама?"

links.title: Annette: ""It's a bookstore, sir! We sell boo..."
links.english: "It's a bookstore, sir! We sell books, postcards, and some board games." She points at the window. "It's called *Crime, Romance, and Biographies of Famous People*."
links.polish: „To księgarnia, psze pana! Sprzedajemy książki, pocztówki i mamy też gry planszowe” – wskazuje na witrynę. „Nazywa się *Kryminał, Romans i Biografie Słynnych Osób*”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта кнігарня, спадар! Мы прадаём кнігі, паштоўкі і ў нас таксама ёсць настольныя гульні", – паказвае на вітрыну. "Яна называецца *Дэтэктыў, Раманс і Біяграфіі Вядомых Асоб*".

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Whoah! WHOAH-WHOAH-WHOAH! Hold your..."
links.english: Whoah! WHOAH-WHOAH-WHOAH! Hold your horses little girl!
links.polish: Łoł! Łoooooł, łoł, łoł! Spokojniej może, dziewczynko!
links.belarusian: Воў! Воў-воў-воў! Спакайней, дзяўчынка!

links.title: You: ""What is a book?""
links.english: "What is a book?"
links.polish: „Co to jest książka?”
links.belarusian: "Што такое кніга?"

links.title: Annette: ""That is a book." She points at the..."
links.english: "That is a book." She points at the stands. "They have stories inside them -- it's like someone told you a story in a really long letter."
links.polish: „To jest książka” – wskazuje na witrynę. „W środku są różne historie – to tak, jakby ktoś coś opowiadał w bardzo długim liście”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта кніга", — паказвае на вітрыну. "Унутры розныя гісторыі — быццам хтосьці распавядаў нешта ў вельмі доўгім лісце".

links.title: Empathy: "She is unfazed by your questions. S..."
links.english: She is unfazed by your questions. She would consider it impolite to point out any perceived weirdness.
links.polish: Twoje pytania nie zbijają jej z tropu. Uważałaby za niegrzeczne twierdzić, że są dziwne.
links.belarusian: Твае пытанні не збіваюць яе з панталыку. Яна палічыла б за няветліва казаць, што яны дзіўныя.

links.title: You: ""What's a postcard?""
links.english: "What's a postcard?"
links.polish: „Co to jest pocztówka?”
links.belarusian: "Што такое паштоўка?"

links.title: Annette: ""A postcard," she observes you for..."
links.english: "A postcard," she observes you for a moment, "is a small cardboard picture. You can write a few words on the other side and send it to your friend or your *beloved*."
links.polish: „Pocztówka” – przygląda ci się przez chwilę badawczo – „to mały kartonowy obrazek. Na odwrocie można coś napisać i wysłać do przyjaciela albo do *ukochanego*”.
links.belarusian: "Паштоўка" – на момант уважліва пазірае на цябе – "гэта маленькае кардоннае малюнак. На адваротным баку можна нешта напісаць і адправіць да сябра альбо да *каханага*".

links.title: You: ""What's a board... game?""
links.english: "What's a board... game?"
links.polish: „Co to jest... gra planszowa?”
links.belarusian: "Што гэта такое... настольная гульня?"

links.title: Annette: ""Board games are like little games..."
links.english: "Board games are like little games on a table, made to pass the time... There are several different ones." She pauses to ponder. "But sailors here mostly buy cards."
links.polish: „Planszówki to takie gry rozkładane na stole, taka rozrywka... Są różne” – ucina, by podzielić się refleksją. „Ale marynarze kupują zazwyczaj karty”.
links.belarusian: "Настольныя гульні — гэта такія гульні, якія раскладваюцца на стале, такая забава... Яны розныя", — адрэзаў, каб падзяліцца развагамі. "Але маракі звычайна купляюць карты".

links.title: You: ""Interesting. Thanks.""
links.english: "Interesting. Thanks."
links.polish: „To ciekawe. Dziękuję”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта цікава. Дзякуй".

links.title: Annette: ""My pleasure! Anything else you'd l..."
links.english: "My pleasure! Anything else you'd like to know?"
links.polish: „To dla mnie przyjemność! Coś jeszcze chciałby pan wiedzieć?”
links.belarusian: "Гэта прыемнасць для мяне! Што-небудзь яшчэ хацелі б вы даведацца?"

links.title: You: "Don't be ridiculous, I know all the..."
links.english: Don't be ridiculous, I know all these things.
links.polish: Nie róbmy sobie żartów, znam te wszystkie rzeczy.
links.belarusian: Не жартуйма, я ведаю ўсе гэтыя рэчы.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You're fooling nobody."
links.english: You're fooling nobody.
links.polish: Kogo ty chcesz oszukać?
links.belarusian: Каго ты хочаш ашукаць?

links.title: You: "Don't you sass me."
links.english: Don't you sass me.
links.polish: Nie pyskuj mi tu.
links.belarusian: Не грубіянь мне тут.

links.title: Annette: ""Sir? Are you okay?" Her voice sudd..."
links.english: "Sir? Are you okay?" Her voice suddenly reaches your mind. "You've been standing here silently for a while now..."
links.polish: „Psze pana? Wszystko w porządku?” – jej głos przebija się nagle do twojej świadomości. „Długo pan tak stoi bez słowa...”
links.belarusian: "Спадар? Усё ў парадку?" – яе голас раптам прабіваецца ў вашу свядомасць. "Вы доўга стаіце так без слова..."

links.title: You: "I said I know all of these things a..."
links.english: I said I know all of these things and I do, god dammit.
links.polish: Jak powiedziałem, że to wiem, to wiem, do cholery.
links.belarusian: Як я сказаў, што гэта ведаю, то ведаю, да д’ябла.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Pfft... books? Postcards? Easy! Eve..."
links.english: Pfft... books? Postcards? Easy! Even a kid would know all of this.
links.polish: Pff. Książki? Pocztówki? Łatwizna! Nawet dzieci wiedzą takie rzeczy.
links.belarusian: Пф. Кнігі? Паштоўкі? Лёгка! Нават дзеці ведаюць такія рэчы.

links.title: You: ""Little girl, I know what a book is..."
links.english: "Little girl, I know what a book is. Books are like very long letters, with stories inside them."
links.polish: „Dziecko, wiem, czym jest książka. To jak taki bardzo długi list, w którym są różne historyjki”.
links.belarusian: "Дзіця, я ведаю, што такое кніга. Гэта як вельмі доўгі ліст, у якім ёсць розныя гісторыі".

links.title: Annette: ""Yes!" She nods, smiling. "That's e..."
links.english: "Yes!" She nods, smiling. "That's exactly it."
links.polish: „Tak!” – przytakuje z uśmiechem. „To są właśnie książki”.
links.belarusian: "Так!" — ківае з усмешкай. "Вось менавіта гэта і ёсць кнігі".

links.title: You: ""I also know what a postcard is......"
links.english: "I also know what a postcard is... it's a small cardboard picture that you can send to a friend or a loved one."
links.polish: „Wiem też, czym jest pocztówka. To taki mały kartonikowy obrazek, który możesz wysłać przyjacielowi albo komuś, kogo kochasz”.
links.belarusian: "Я таксама ведаю, што такое паштоўка. Гэта такая маленькая картаная выява, якую ты можаш адправіць сябру альбо каму-небудзь, каго любіш".

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm mhm. You've got it, sir. What..."
links.english: "Mhm mhm. You've got it, sir. What about board games?"
links.polish: „Mhm, mhm. Dobrze pan mówi. A planszówki?”
links.belarusian: "Мгм, мгм. Добра вы кажаце. А настольныя гульні?"

links.title: You: ""Who cares about board games? No on..."
links.english: "Who cares about board games? No one."
links.polish: „A kogo obchodzą planszówki? Nikogo”.
links.belarusian: "А каго цікавіць настольныя гульні? Нікога".

links.title: Annette: ""Okay, sir. This was all very... *e..."
links.english: "Okay, sir. This was all very... *enlightening*. Can I help you with anything else?"
links.polish: „No dobrze, psze pana. To było bardzo... *pouczające*. Mogę jeszcze w czymś pomóc?”
links.belarusian: "Ну што ж, пане. Гэта было вельмі... *пазнавальна*. Ці магу я яшчэ чымсьці дапамагчы?"

links.title: You: ""The police don't have time for gam..."
links.english: "The police don't have time for games."
links.polish: „Policjanci nie mają czasu na gry”.
links.belarusian: "Міліцыянты не маюць часу на гульні".

links.title: You: ""I like playing games... with peopl..."
links.english: "I like playing games... with peoples' minds."
links.polish: „Lubię gierki... ale z ludzkimi umysłami”.
links.belarusian: "Люблю гульні... але з чалавечымі розумамі".

links.title: You: ""Alright, I think that was enough...."
links.english: "Alright, I think that was enough. I have proven myself."
links.polish: „No dobra, chyba wystarczy. Pokazałem, co umiem”.
links.belarusian: "Ну добра, мабыць, дастаткова. Паказаў, што ўмею".

links.title: Annette: ""If you say so, sir. Can I help you..."
links.english: "If you say so, sir. Can I help you with anything else?"
links.polish: „Skoro pan tak twierdzi. Mogę jeszcze w czymś pomóc?”
links.belarusian: "Калі вы так сцвярджаеце. Ці магу я яшчэ чымсьці дапамагчы?"

links.title: You: "Nah, it feels inappropriate to lect..."
links.english: Nah, it feels inappropriate to lecture this girl.
links.polish: Nie, prawienie kazań tej dziewczynce nie wydaje się słuszne.
links.belarusian: Не, чытаць пропаведзі гэтай дзяўчынцы не здаецца правільным.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Don't be a fool -- as an expert, it..."
links.english: Don't be a fool -- as an expert, it's your duty to tell what you know to everyone.
links.polish: Nie bądź głupi. Twoim obowiązkiem jako eksperta jest opowiadać wszystkim, co wiesz.
links.belarusian: Не будзь дурнем. Тваім абавязкам як эксперта з'яўляецца распавядаць усім, што ты ведаеш.

links.title: You: "Don't tell me what to do."
links.english: Don't tell me what to do.
links.polish: Nie mów mi, co mam robić.
links.belarusian: Не кажы мне, што я павінен рабіць.

links.title: Annette: ""Sir? Are you okay?" Her voice sudd..."
links.english: "Sir? Are you okay?" Her voice suddenly reaches your mind. "You've been standing here silently for a while now..."
links.polish: „Psze pana? Wszystko w porządku?” – jej głos przebija się nagle do twojej świadomości. „Długo pan tu tak stoi bez słowa...”
links.belarusian: "Пане? Усё ў парадку?" – яе голас раптам прабіваецца да вашай свядомасці. "Вы доўга тут так стаіце без слова..."

links.title: You: "Hey now, I already made up my mind."
links.english: Hey now, I already made up my mind.
links.polish: Ejże, sam już podjąłem decyzję.
links.belarusian: Ну вось, я ўжо прыняў рашэнне.

links.title: You: ""Is it okay if I ask you some quest..."
links.english: "Is it okay if I ask you some questions?"
links.polish: „Mogę zadać ci kilka pytań?”
links.belarusian: "Ці магу я задаць табе некалькі пытанняў?"

links.title: Annette: ""Okay, sir. I'll try to answer any..."
links.english: "Okay, sir. I'll try to answer any questions you have. I hope they're about books."
links.polish: „Dobrze, psze pana. Spróbuję pomóc. Mam nadzieję, że to pytania o książki”.
links.belarusian: "Добра, спадар. Паспрабую дапамагчы. Спадзяюся, што гэта пытанні пра кнігі".

links.title: You: ""Not really." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Not really." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Nie bardzo”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Не вельмі". [Адыдзі].

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Hello, sir! Step right in, the sto..."
dialogueTree.english: "Hello, sir! Step right in, the store is open!" A young girl with chubby red cheeks waves at you, smiling. Her nose is also red from the cold.
dialogueTree.polish: „Psze pana! Zapraszam, mamy otwarte!” – dziewczynka o zarumienionych wydatnych policzkach macha do ciebie, uśmiechając się. Ma nos czerwony od zimna.
dialogueTree.belarusian: "Спадар пан! Запрашаем, у нас адчынена!" – дзяўчынка з заружанымі круглявымі шчочкамі махае табе, усміхаючыся. У яе нос чырвоны ад холаду.

links.title: You: ""Hello.""
links.english: "Hello."
links.polish: „Witam”.
links.belarusian: "Вітаю".

links.title: Annette: ""Are you interested in a new and ex..."
links.english: "Are you interested in a new and exciting book?" She stomps her feet to feel warmer.
links.polish: „Chciałby pan kupić nową, wciągającą książkę?” – drepcze w miejscu, by się rozgrzać.
links.belarusian: "Ці не хацелі б вы набыць новую, захапляльную кнігу?" – тупае на месцы, каб сагрэцца.

Alternate2.english: "Are you interested in a new and exciting book?"
Alternate2.belarusian: "Ці хацелі б вы набыць новую, захапляльную кнігу?"

links.title: You: ""I am the law.""
links.english: "I am the law."
links.polish: „Prawo to ja”.
links.belarusian: "Закон гэта я".

links.title: Annette: ""I know, sir." She stomps her feet..."
links.english: "I know, sir." She stomps her feet to feel warmer.
links.polish: „Wiem, psze pana” – drepcze w miejscu, by się rozgrzać.
links.belarusian: "Ведаю, спадар", — тупае на месцы, каб сагрэцца.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everyone understands you're *the l..."
links.english: "Everyone understands you're *the law*. That's why you have that insignia on your arm. So you don't have to keep saying it."
links.polish: „Wszyscy rozumieją, że jesteś *prawem*. To dlatego masz insygnia na ramieniu. Więc nie musisz tego ciągle powtarzać”.
links.belarusian: "Усе разумеюць, што ты з’яўляешся *законам*. Таму ў цябе ёсць знакі адрознення на плячы. Так што няма патрэбы ўвесь час гэта паўтараць".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, people get that you are *the..."
links.english: "Yes, people get that you are *the law*. You really don't have to keep saying it."
links.polish: „Tak, ludzie wiedzą, że jesteś *prawem*. Naprawdę nie musisz tego ciągle powtarzać”.
links.belarusian: "Так, людзі ведаюць, што ты *закон*. Насамрэч не трэба гэта пастаянна паўтараць".

links.title: You: ""Hi.""
links.english: "Hi."
links.polish: „Cześć”.
links.belarusian: "Прывітанне".
